description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 8 (AP) Terry Bradshaw led a 16point second  quarter spurt that gave the Pittsburgh Steelers a 190 triumph over the Atlanta Falcons tonight in the National Football League preseason finals for both teams.

title: WALL STREET
description: When some investors look at the vast wasteland we used to call a stock market, they fondly remember the days when concept stocks were In fashion.

title: GUNMAN WOUNDS 2, IS SLAIN BY CROWD
description: A gunman was shot an beaten to death by an angry crowd last night after he had wounded two women in a burst of gunfire in the East Tremont section of the Bronx.

title: Dairy Hearing to Reopen
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI) Pleas from dairymen who want a continued increase in Government minimum floors for milk sold under Federal marketing orders will be heard when an Agriculture Department hearing on the issue reopens Sept. 18 at Clayton, Mo., the Agriculture Department has announced.

title: Governor of American Samoa to Be Tried on Hatch Act Charges
description: PAGOPAGO, American Somoa, Sept. 8  John M. Haydon, Governor of American Samoa, goes on trial here Tuesday accused of six counts of having violated the Hatch Act.

title: Wendy Lyon Has Nuptials
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 8Miss Wendy Bacon Lyon and Gustavo Higinio Fanjul were married here this afternoon in Christ Episcopal Church. The rector, the Rev. J. Seymour Flinn, performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Vincent O'Connor of St. Catherine of Sienna Roman Catholic Church in Riverside.

title: Temple Beats Xavier, 497
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept, 8 (UPI)Marty Ginestra, a quarterback, came off the bench to toss three secondquarter touchdown passes and spark Temple to a 497 victory over Xavier tonight. Xavier fumbled three kickoffs to help the Owls in their romp.

title: Should Niagara Falls Look Like This?
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N. Y.Believe it or not, there is a drive under way to renovate Niagara Falls. Twohundred thousand ballots are being circulated on both the American and Canadian sides of the Falls by an organization set up by the official U.S.Canadian border agency, and, at this moment, townspeople and visitors are using them to vote for whichever of several redecoration plans they happen to fancy. If the proponents of these socalled improvements get their way, many of the great rocks that have tumbled to the foot of the American Fallsas the cataract on the American side of the border is calledwill be removed and unsightly control gates will be installed in the channel leading to the crest to increase the flow of water. Another scheme (a model of which is pictured above) would replace the rockfall at the base with a series of steps. This particular arrangement is grandiosely referred to by its adherents as The Temple of Osiris. In one way or another, the renovators believe they can upgrade one of the world's great natural spectacles by changing it physically.

title: Anas Nin Reader Edited by Philip K. Jason. Introduction by Anna Balahian. 316 pp. Chicago: The Swallow Press. $8.95.
description: With the publication of her Diary, of which four volumes have appeared since 1966, Anas Nin emerged from partial obscurity and took her place among the successful writers of the day who have a fairly wide and faithful public. The publication of the Anas Nin Reader signals the fact that her work is now extensive enough to warrant an anthology, helpful both to new readers who wish to learn of her work and sample it quickly, and to those older readers who wish to review her work as a whole.

title: L I R.R. TO SHIFT 76 UNDER NEW RULES
description: About 75 Long Island Rail Road trainmen and engineers who feel they have become pawns in a women's liberation skirmish have been notified by the line that they are to be reassigned because they do not meet new physical requirements.

title: Theater in Buenos Aires
description: LONDON, New York and Paris are usually thought as the world's leading theater towns, and in that order. Buenos Aires, however, deserves to be added to them and placed between London and New York. What New York is theatrically to the northern half of the Western Hemisphere, Buenos Aires is to the southern. Buenos Aires's Great White Way is the Avenida Corrientes, ablaze with lights and crowded until the early hours of the morning. As in New York, however, the really interesting theater here is the offCorrientes the small basement houses that specialize in the production of new Argentinian plays, while the Corrientes theaters specialize in Broadway imports or indigenous imitations of Broadway shows.

title: A BOYHOOD FEND PAYS CALL ON MAO
description: Chairman Mao Tsetung is alert and energetic in spite of his advanced age, according to a boyhood friend, a physician, who saw him last month in Peking after a separation of more than 50 years.

title: Congregation Moving From Tent in Queens
description: For 11 years, members of Temple Judea of Lindenwood, Queens, worshiped in a tent on the High Holy Days and were subjected to the roaring tremors of lowflying aircraft taking off and landing at nearby John F. Kennedy International Airport.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Once upon a time, two crooks defrauded a dumb emperor with the now famous so  called emperor's  new clothes game, which they had read about in the police news.

title: RECYCLING MODE USED AT AIR BASE
description: FORT WORTH, Sept. 8The lanky exB52 pilot calls himself the garbage officer of Carswell Air Force Base here. Lieut. Col. David Sussman flew bombers for 18 years before his final Air Force assignmentto devise a system to recycle waste generated on the 10,000man military base here.

title: JACQUELINE STANDING
description: Jacqueline Hope Standing, assistant to the advertising director of Texas Star magazine, which is syndicated with 27 newspapers in Texas, died Thursday in Bethesda, Md. She was 52 years old and lived at 667 Ocean Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: Charles Alan Wright
description: WASHINGTONOn the wall of the narrow, almost monastic White House office, there was a new addition on Friday, a chased brass plate on polished wooden base that read: Buzhardt, Garment and Wright, Counselors at Law. A most unusual firm for a most unusual client.

title: Idaho Triumphs, 6214
description: MOSCOW, Idaho, Sept. 8 (UPI)  Marshall Brantley scored three touchdowns and rushed for 119 yards to lead Idaho to a 6214 victory over TexasEl Paso today. Brantly scored on runs of 39, 49, and 2 yards. Steve Tanner kicked 7 extra points.

title: Reality is waiting in ambush, beyond the fiction
description: An elegant Argentinian girl, about to be married, is haunted by the thought of a double on the other side of the world, a ragged, suffering twin in Budapest. She persuades her husband to take her to Hungary for her honeymoon and there, on a bridge she has seen more than once in her dreams, she embraces her other, older self, changes places with her and watches her return, in her clothes, to her marriage, which ends in divorce two months later. This is a bald summary of a delicate, elusive story by Julio Cortazar called The Distancesit appeared in English in an earlier collection, End of the Game. Several of Cortazar's most loved themes are there, and all of them recur in this new volume of eight stories, ably translated by Suzanne Jill Levine.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: To Create a New Chinese Musical Idiom
description: Chou WenChung, acting dean of the School of the Arts, Columbia University, is the first composer from the West to visit China in more than a quarter of a century. Born in China, Professor Chou came here in 1946, when he was 23 years old. He is now an American citizen. His trip was of a private, unofficial nature.

title: 2 Garden Bouts to Liven AliNorton TV Showing
description: Live fighters and, presumably, live horses will complement the closedcircuit telecast tomorrow night of the Muhammad AliKen Norton fight from Los Angeles.

title: Cervantes Retains Crown on Knockout
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Sept. 8 (AP)Antonio (Kid Pambele) Cervantes of Colombia successfully defended his world junior welterweight crown tonight by knocking out Carlos Maria Gimenez of Argentina in the fifth round of their scheduled 15rounder.

title: Reports of Fixed Races Are Belittled by Drivers
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Sept. 8 Real Cormier, a driver, considered the question only for a moment. Were races fixed at Roosevelt Raceway, as a Federal investigation would lead people to believe?

title: Minimum Rates Proposed For Ocean Charter Flights
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board has proposed minimum rates for North Atlantic charter flights and says that it will investigate any airline charter fares lower than those proposed by the board.

title: Adrienne Ames Wilds Has Bridal
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 8Miss Adrienne Ames Wilds and Fergus Kirkpatrick were married here this afternoon in the garden of the home of the bride's parM. Wilds in Belle Haven. The bridegroom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Kirkpatrick, also of Belle Haven.

title: ISRAEL TO PRESS A SEARCH FOR OIL
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 Pinchas Sapir, Israel's Finance Minister, told American and Canadian Jewish leaders today that Israel would intensify her search for oil in the near future, based on encouraging reports by geologists.

title: BOMB INJURES FIVE AT LONDON STATION
description: LONDON, Sept. 9 (AP)A time bomb exploded inside London's Victoria Station yesterday and three firebombs ignited in the center of Manchester early today.

title: U.S. Loses Baseball Bid
description: BOLOGNA, Italy, Sept. 8 (UPI)The United States lost its bid for the championship of the first Intercontinental Baseball Cup tournament by dropping a 9.2 decision to Puerto Rico tonight. Japan, which had been tied for first place with the United States entering the final day's program, took the championship with a 1.0 victory over Canada, for a 61 record. The United States and Puerto Rico tied for second with five victories and two losses.

title: Nancy Jean Graves Is Bride of Frederick J. Wilson 3d
description: WAKEFIELD, R. I., Sept. 8Miss Nancy Jean Graves, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Hubert Newton Graves, was married here this afternoon to Frederick James Wilson 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Wilson Jr.

title: Son to the Jeffrey Bells
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Jeffrey C. Bell of Riverdale, the Bronx, last Sunday in the University Hospital. The child has been named Joshua Graham. Mrs. Bell is the former Miss Joan G. Feinstein. Her husband is director of national sales for Leasco Information Products, Inc., New York.

title: From Eagle to Spring
description: WASHINGTONDuring those hot and humid Washington days, while watching the Watergate proceedings on TV, I realized how much I was longing for the things Laotzu admired the most: the freshness of the valley. the stillness of a woman, the virtuous innocence of a child and above all the yielding water. Alas, there is no water in the Watergate, and if there was, it must be now dirtied and polluted by plots and intrigues.

title: 2 Unexploded Bombs Found In Theater 8 Hours Apart
description: Two explosive devices were found within an eighthour period yesterday at the Paramount Theater, Broadway and 61st Street.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The prospective opening of Queens Center [Shopping Downtown Emerges on Queens Boulevard, Aug. 26] was publicized as a great boon, costing millions of dollars, with the expectation of the operators to make millions. But the article failed to report the effect of this big event on the residents of the area.

title: Third World
description: ALGIERS  The setting Is idyllic. Twelve miles to the west, lowlying cream and blue villas overlook the equally blue Mediterranean, all calm and sparkle under the hot sun. But the villas are occupied by 76 representatives of the underdeveloped world, and when they congregate in the Palace of Nations, the modern conference hall nearby, they talk of the far from idyllic situations they and their countries confront.

title: Paul Lautaud, 18721956
description: PARIS All lives are interesting; no one life is more interesting than another. Its fascination depends on how much is revealed, and in what manner. In the rainy Paris winter of 1950 I heard, by chance, a radio interview that had the tone of natural conversation. Someone l at first took to be an old woman was recalling a 19thcentury childhood and pair of unbelievably disastrous parents. The voice was mocking and lively, the dreadful recital was broken by hoots of sudden laughter. Presently I realized the speaker must be a man, either a writer or an actor.

title: U.S. Plans to Tighten Rule On Imported Milk Items
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI) The Agriculture Department announced yesterday plans to tighten enforcement of a regulation that allows use of imported milk products from some countries for human food but bans them from use in animal feed.

title: 6.5Mile Bikeway Is Planned in Queens
description: The City Department of Highways may not be building a highspeed, crosstown thruway or a congestion link to the suburbs, but it appears certain to win popular approval with its latest projecta bikeway through Queens.

title: 2CAR CRASH KILLS 6 AND INJURES 5 MORE
description: EVANS MILLS, N. Y., Sept. 8 (AP)Six persons were killed last night when a station wagon carrying nine members of a St. Lawrence County family to a wedding was struck by another car and exploded in flames. Five, others were injured.

title: Kissinger Hearings
description: WASHINGTON  While President Nixon was still locked in conflict with Congress last week, his Secretary of Statedesignate, Henry A. Kissinger, sought to make a separate peace with the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, which has the task of formally acting on his nomination.

title: Player Captures Lead In Southern Open on 201
description: COLUMBUS, Ga., Sept. 8 (AP)Gary Player, rounding into superstar form once again after recent surgery, mastered intense heat and shot a 67 today for a twostroke margin after 54 holes of the $100,000 Southern open golf tournament.

title: Qaddafi
description: BEIRUTLibya's action in taking over Western oil companies and raising the price of Libyan crude oil, has set the stage for a new tussle between Middle Eastern oilproducing countries and the Western petroleum industry.

title: Heidi Dolan Is Married to Bernard C. Baldwin 3d
description: WILTON, Conn., Sept. 8Miss Heidi Dolan and Bernard Coleman Baldwin 3d were married here this afternoon in the Wilton Congregational Church. The Rev. Dr. John Paul Archibald and the Rev. Dr. Zdenek F. Bednar officiated.

title: Biaggi Says He Would Make Policemen Wear Uniforms to and From Job
description: Representative Mario Biaggi declared yesterday that if he were elected Mayor he would require all police officers to, wear their uniforms to and from work as a deterrent to crime.

title: World News Briefs
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland Sept. 8 (UPI) A bomb in ?? beer barrel in the trunk of ?? car damaged a bar in Belfast's A??trim road early today an?? injured a soldier's hand. A?? army spokesman said the ma?? was not badly hurt.

title: Newark Airport Welcomes Terminal B This Week
description: NEWARK  A week of celebrations gets under way tomorrow at Newark International Airport, with special dedication ceremonies scheduled for Wednesday and a Slant open house for the public planned for Saturday.

title: Pirates Recall McKee
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 8 (UPI) The Pittsburgh Pirates announced today they had recalled Jim McKee, a righthanded pitcher, from their Charleston farm club in the International League.

title: A great deal more than soy sauce
description: CHICAGO. Only 10 years ago many farmers considered the soybean little more than a cover crop, to be planted and then plowed under to restore the soil. But today the soybean has achieved real glamourall of a sudden it seems that everybody in the world wants soybeans, and if you had been fortunate enough to have 5,000 bushels of them to sell last June, you'd have grossed a cool $60,000. At recent prices, soybeans have easily passed corn to become the nation's No. 1 cash crop.

title: Italy's Cholera
description: ROMEOn Aug. 20 an English girl, a dancer, was taken to a hospital in Naples with severe gastrointestinal pain. Doctors and nurses whispered the name of the killer disease that had made the girl illa disease they had long thought relegated to, and isolated in, teeming, backward countries east of Suez. The disease was cholera.

title: Banner Year for the Shore
description: SEASIDE HEIGHTS  The prolonged heat wave that finally abated last week was the big salvation for the state's shore resorts, which had been plagued earlier this summer by outbreaks of pollution, youth disturbances and bad weather.

title: Seoul Forbids Students To View The Godfather
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 8 (UPI)The South Korean Education Ministry has forbidden elementary and high school students to view the film The Godfather.

title: Headliners
description: On the fourth day of their adventure, the five Palestinian gunmen who had occupied the Saudi Arabian Embassy in Paris, then a Syrian airliner and then a Kuwaiti plane, appeared ready to call the whole thing off.

title: NIXON BIDS CITIES ANDRES AVERT HEATING OIL CRISIS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8President Nixon urged states and cities today to relax environmental rules this winter to avert what he said could be a very serious shortage of heating oil.

title: Kessinger's Hit Is Key
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 8 (AP) Don Kessinger's run scoring single with the score 11 in the seventh inning sent the Chicago Cubs on to a 31 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals today.

title: Judith Thomas Betrothed
description: CHEVY CHASE, Md., Sept. 8Dr. and Mrs. Lawrence Jay Thomas have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Judith Lynn Thomas, to Robert Alan Gaston, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Gaston of Lido Beach, L. I., and Chester, N. J. Miss Thomas, an alumna of Simmons College, received a master's degree from American University. Her fianc graduated from Boston University.

title: Not Good Enough
description: Once again President Nixon has answered questions about his San Clemente real estate dealings by creating fresh obscurities.

title: OCTANE RATINGS CAN BE CONFUSING
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8Octane ratings must be posted on all gasoline pumps under a Phase 4 economic regulation that went into effect yesterday. But whether this enlightens or confuses consumers is an unanswered question.

title: Judith DuLyn Barclay Howe To Wed Oct. 6
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., Sept. 8Mr. and Mrs. Francis Winthrop DuLyn have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Judith Deane DuLyn, to Barclay Gardner Howe of Simsbury, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nathaniel Salstonstall Howe of Lyme, formerly of Oyster Bay, L. I., and New York. An Oct. 6 wedding is planned.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE COST OF LIVING COUNCIL, in wideranging actions, removed the meat price freeze early, scaled back auto price increases, obtained a temporary suspension in oil and gas price increases and set hearings on other price matters. . . . The Federal Reserve Board raised reserve requirements on large denomination certificates of deposit.

title: Brandt Appears to Back Soviet Union Dissidents
description: BONN, West Germany, Sept. 8 (AP)Chancellor Willy Brandt issued a carefully worded statement today implying support for embattled Soviet dissidents a day after the scientist Andrei D. Sakharov said that a word from Mr. Brandt would help them.

title: What's New, Recherche and Zany?
description: THERE goes summer, here comes fall, and the 197374 music season is upon us with another gargantuan serving of operas, orchestral concerts and recitals by all kinds of instruments and voices, And whether one's three B's are Bach, Beethoven and Brahms or Berlioz, Bruckner and Bartok, he can be fairly certain that they and other giants in the pantheon of composers will figure prominently in standard programs. Similarly, the luminous stars among performers will be out again and shining in their wellknown fields of specialization.

title: Yankees Rout Brewers, 151
description: From one of their most lethargic showings of the year in their loss to Milwaukee the night before, the Yankees exploded with their most potent batting display of 1973 yesterday as they crushed the Brewers, 151.

title: 40 Million Newspaper Readers to Get Option to Study College Course in an Educational Experiment
description: SAN DIEGO, Sept. 8  Beginning late this month, about, 40 million newspaper readers will be given an opportunity to take a college course, with or without academic credit, under a novel experiment in adult education sponsored by the Government.

title: Airlines Ordered to Check All Emergency Equipment
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP) The Federal Aviation Administration has ordered the nation's airlines to start making periodic inspections of all onboard emergency equipment.

title: Chile Finds Crisis to Be Normal Now
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 27Plaza Constitucin is the center of Chile's political crisis. Here there are almost daily demonstrations for or against the nation's Socialist President, Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2.

title: Remembrance of rationing past
description: As I cut into my $1.99apound pork chop and think of the depleted beef section at the supermarket, I summon up remembrances of things past. How many in the class remember World War II rationing? The reason I ask is that as each day seems to bring with it a new shortage whether gasoline, fuel oil, wheat, soybeans, canned goodsit seems we stood and talked like this before and I can remember where or when.

title: Arthur Daley
description: As this season slipped into the September homestretch, baseball's leading home run hitter for the year was not Henry Aaron or Willie Stargell or any of the other big boomers with documented reputations as long ball smashers. He was, instead, Dave Johnson, as unlikely a candidate as could be proposed as the home run king of the major leagues. Although he may never last until coronation day, the palace coup he quietly set in motion has made a surprising amount of progress. Before the Baltimore Orioles traded him last winter to the Atlanta Braves, the main recognition that had come to Johnson was as a competent glove man anywhere in the infield, but especially at second base. None regarded him as a slugger. His highest homer total in any one season had been 18 in 1971, while his average output over nine years was only a shade above seven homers a season.

title: The Economy
description: WASHINGTONIt was a confusing week for the consumer. He found himself paying somewhat lower prices for a few things like chicken that had previously gone through the roof, but he read of a record wholesale price increase, a staggering 23 per cent in a single month, for general farm products in August.

title: Carving Found on Sinai Cliff Shows Mysterious Pharoah
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 8 (AP)A cliffside carving of a mysterious Pharoah has been found near an ancient turquoise mine in the Sinai Desert.

title: Canada
description: OTTAWAA rate of inflation that until recently was worse than that of the United States and a shaky minority position in Parliament are the two big problems now facing Canada's Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau. So, when Mr. Trudeau introduced legislation last week to deal with the soaring prices, he was asked to what degree he had been influenced by demands from the boisterous opposition parties.

title: MRS. WILLIAM G. JORDAN
description: JERSEY CITY, Sept. 8Mrs. Rita McLaughlin Jordan, the mother of Mayor Paul T. Jordan of Jersey City, died of cancer this afternoon at her home at 56 Kensington Avenue. She was 58 years old and was the widow of William G. Jordan who was principal of Public School 17 here.

title: Recordings
description: ALOT of headshaking accompanied Philips's announcement last spring that yet another complete recording of Wagner's Ring des Nibelungen cycle was on the way. With four editions already available, could the classical record market, hardly very bullish even in the best of times, really support a fifth set of this epical and costly (to both producer and purchaser) tetralogy?

title: French Racism Egalit But Not Fraternit
description: PARISLast month, a demented Algerian immigrant worker taking a bus in Marseilles killed the driver after being reminded, first, that he had to pay for his ticket and, second, that the ticket had to be punched. The Algerian also injured four passengers and then was nearly lynched by the crowd. There ensued a strike by the bus driver's colleagues, and then a counterstrike of 18,000 North African workers to protest racism. The episode culminated in the killing of several Arabs by selfstyled vigilantes.

title: RUMANIA REVIVES A CANAL PROJECT
description: BUCHAREST, Sept. 2 The Rumanian Communist leadership has decided to resume the digging of a large canal between the Black Sea ana the Danube, a project many Rumanians remember with dread.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
Businessmen Aid The Unemployed
description: JERICHO, L. I.Like ships in the night, job hunters and companies seeking trained workers sometimes pass each other by. But thanks to the National Alliance of Businessmen, that no longer is a major problem in Nassau and Suffolk Counties.

title: About Alice, a rabbit, a tree . . .
description: Look, Shel, I said, the trouble with this Giving Tree of yours is that it falls between two stools; it's not a kid's booktoo sad, and it isn't for adultstoo simple. This was in 1963; I was working at Simon & Schuster; Shel was Shel Silverstein, and the manuscript was The Giving Tree, which Harper & Row subsequently published, and which has sold over 150.000 copies. Kurt Vonnegut must have some kind of philosophical saying for the way I feel now.

title: Meet My Ham and Swiss
description: IT was just a joke I heard on TV on Al's poker night. In a comedy skit the man says to his wife, Make me a malted. The wife holds out her hands like a magician and says, Poof, you're a malted. Seems I heard that somewhere before, maybe in other comedy skits, but that night I died laughing all by myself with Al out at poker and the kids in bed.

title: Briton Weds Africa Migrant to Stop Deportation
description: BRIGHTON, England, Sept. (AP)  Melvyn Sharman and Moira Simbi got married today during the second and perhaps the last meeting of their lives.

title: A Decline Found in White Pupils In San Francisco Public Schools
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 8The number of white students in the city's public elementary schools has declined to almost half of what it was five years ago, according to a study released this week by a private citizens' group.

title: Terrorists Free Hostages And Surrender inkuwait
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 8Five Palestinian guerrillas who had been holding four Saudi Arabian hostages aboard an airliner at the Kuwait airport surrendered tonight and released their prisoners unharmed, according to the Kuwaiti radio.

title: Heat Wave It Was Bad While It Lasted
description: Hardly anyone noticed at first when a large circular air mass, which began life over Canada with brisk temperatures, oozed over the American midwest, heated up, drifted east and clamped itself down on the Atlantic Coast, inflicting more than a week of sticky, smoggy days on 50 million people in the area.

title: Ann Franke Dead at 75; Was Industrial Designer
description: Ann Franke, an industrial and technical designer, died Friday at Will Rogers Hospital in Saranac Lake, N. Y. She was 75 years old, and resided at 446 East 66th Street.

title: Today, the teacher's union . . .
description: The chieftains of a dozen powerful international unions clustered around the door of a Florida hotel room early this year, each intent upon a private chat with the top man. But when George Meany, president of the A.F.L.C.I.O., emerged, his attention was all for the head of a mere local union, the youngest man in the group.

title: What Corset Ads?
description: At the risk of escalating a minicrisis into a maxi, we must correct the President on corrections in newspapers. Asked at his news conference about the taxes on his San Clemente home, Mr. Nixon responded that the private audit he commissioned had given the lie to reports carried usually in eightcolumn heads in most papers, but the retraction ended back up with the corset ads.

title: Giants 2110 Victors
description: AKRON, Ohio, Sept. 8Ron Johnson rambled into high gear for the first time this year, and the New York Giants rolled past the Cleveland Browns, 2110, tonight for their sixth victory and a perfect preseason record.

title: Who Is Saying What
description: Julie Heldman, describing what happened when the heat and humidity at Forest Hills forced Billie Jean King to forfeit their tennis match in the U.S. Open: The sting went out of her serve and she stopped running for shots. Then my forehand was getting better, so I was just trying to hang in there. B. J. can beat anybody when she's running, even Bobby Riggs, but when she's not, she's mortal like the rest of us.

title: Abigail F. Merriam Is Bride Of Scott Charles Lederman
description: POUND RIDGE, N. Y., Sept. 8Miss Abigail Frances Merriam, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Power Merriam, was married at home here today to Scott Charles Lederman, son of Col. Milton D. Lederman, U.S.A., retired, of Arlington, Va., and Mrs. Samuel Banks of Glendale, Ariz. The Rev. Richard S. Monkman of the Pound Ridge Community Church performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. John D. Olofson of the Simsbury (Conn.) Methodist Church.

title: A Rugged Introduction to College Life
description: PISCATAWAY Freshmen and transfer students at Livingston College tackled an obstacle course last week as a novel introduction to academic life. The course was designed to teach the new students to live and work together as a team within their campus environment and to test their ingenuity.

title: 36 Are Arrested for Drugs at Nassau Coliseum
description: The mass arrests of marijuana smokers at the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, L. I., are part of a continuing policy and could in no way be interpreted as a crackdown, John MacDonald, assistant police commissioner of Nassau County said yesterday.

title: Homestretch Is Her Madison Avenue
description: Working six days a week at a race track is hardly Everywoman's dream job, but then, Francine Plotnick is not Everywoman. She is the only woman jockey agent at Monmouth Park and she wouldn't change jobs for all the chromeandglass offices on Madison Avenue. It's a crazy lifebut I love it, said the 23yearold Miss Plotnick, who arrives at the track each day at 6:30 A.M. to drum up rides for a jockey, Carlos Lopez. You can't survive in this business unless you're aggressive, ambitious and a fast talker. And I am.

title: Patrolman Spurs Block Association
description: William J. Liell, a City Housing Authority patrolman, is an exuberant man of 42 who can be a source of irritation to the neighbors who are apathetic to the community activity on his block in Brooklyn's Park Slope section.

title: REDS STILL CLASH INSIDE CAMBODIA
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 8  Fighting between North Vietnamese troops and Cambodian Communists is continuing in southeasten Cambodia despite attempts by some senior officials of both sides to stop it, American intelligence sources said today.

title: Professor to Marry Miss Mary Duncan
description: Mr. and Mrs. Donald W. Duncan of Lincoln, Neb., have announced here the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Duncan, to Richard B. Dinsmore, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert D. Dinsmore of Forest Hills, Queens.

title: News of the Stage
description: Arthur Miller has granted permission to the University Players of the University of Michigan to do scenes next spring from his uncompleted play, The American Clock, based partly on Studs Terkel's book Hard Times, which deals with the Depression of the nineteenthirties.

title: Rugby Team Off On English Tour
description: The Westchester Rugby Club has departed for a 15day tour of England, during which it will play five matches.

title: JOINT SPACE FLIGHT SCHEDULES 18 TESTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP) Experiments ranging from studies of the body's defense mechanism to a search for a potential new field of astronomy will be conducted during the AmericanSoviet joint manned space mission in 1975, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration announced yesterday.

title: Two Paths
description: There are two paths to improvement of human affairs. One is directed toward changing the objective social and economic circumstances in which people live. The other tries to change people's minds and hearts, Each is a valid approach. Rather than alternatives, they are complementary to one another.

title: Skylab 2 Crewmen Spend, Their Day Off by Working
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 9 (UPI)The Skylab 2 astronauts spent a busy day off today, keeping a watchful eye on the sun and taking pictures of the earth with their special space cameras to help farmers in Mexico.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Woman in Bias Suit Assures Trainmen

title: Swiss Attack Portuguese
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, Sept. 9 (AP)Filteen persons, including six policemen, were injured in a clash yestetday when leftwing demonstrators throwing firebombs and paint bags tried to force their way into the Portuguese exhibit at the Swiss Trade Fair. The police used tear gas and riot sticks to control the demonstrators, who were shouting Portuguese Fascists get out!

title: Redskins 173 Victors Over Bears
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9The Washington Redskins polished off the Chicago Bears, 173, tonight in the National Football League's final preseason game. The Redskins, expected by many to start their second trip to the Super Bowl next Sunday, indicated they were prepared. Coach George Allen has had this seasoned team ready for five weeks and this was Washington's fifth straight exhibition victory after an opening loss to Detroit.

title: Monetary Fund Reports Poor Nations Have Gained
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9The boom in the industrialized countries, soaring commodity prices and heavy inflows of private capital combined to give the developing countries their best payments balances on record in 1972 and early 1973, the International Monetary Fund reported today.

title: SwissIsraeli Talks
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 9 (UPI)The Swiss Foreign Minister, Pierre Graber, arrived in Israel today for a fiveday official visit, saying that he had come for information about the Middle East conflict and that Switzerland's neutrality should not he confused with indifference. Mr. Graber is scheduled to hold talks with Premier Golda Meir and Foreign Minister Abba Eban.

title: A Tribute to Copernicus
description: This year, the 500th anniversary of the birth of Copernicus was commemorated with a piano recital by Mieczyslaw Horszowski at the Hayden Planetarium. At Carnegie Hall on Saturday night, another piano recital observing the same anniversary was given by another Polish pianist. This one was Adam Harasiewicz, a 41  year  old musician who won first prize in the 1955 Chopin Competition in Warsaw. The recital was presented as a benefit for Polish Assistance, Inc.

title: MRS. ALFRED B. MACLAY
description: MILLBROOK, N. Y., Sept. 9 Mrs. Louise Fleischmann Maclay, widow of Alfred B. Maclay, a banker and president of the American Horse Shows Association, died today at her home, Killearn Farm. She was 88 years old.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: After 59 historic years on the Lower East Side, the Folksbiene, one of New York's oldest acting troupes, is moving from its theater in the Jewish Daily Forward building at 175 East Broadway to the Central Synagogue Theater, Lexington Avenue and 55th Street. The venerable Yiddishlanguage group will offer as its first production of the new season Sholem Aleichem's comedy, Stempenyu, on Nov. 3. The Daily Forward is moving to its new headquarters at Madison Avenue and 33d Street, and is expected to have a new theater ready for the Folksbiene next year.

title: London Enjoying Priestley Revival
description: LONDON, Sept. 9  Oh classicism! Two London plays seen on the same day, as chance befell  raised my classic consciousness. One was Shakespeare's Twelfth Night, an indisputable classic, but here nonclassically played, and the other was J. B. Priestley's An Inspector Calls.

title: U.S SCIENCE BODY CAUTIONS SOVIET ON SAKHARO V OASE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9The National Academy of Sciences warned Soviet authorities today that the arrest or further harassment of Andrei D. Sakharov, the outspoken Soviet physicist, could lead to a curtailment of American scientific cooperation with the Soviet Union.

title: Weekly List of Mutual Funds
Funston's Mother Dies Special to the New York Tines
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 9Mrs. Genevieve Keith Funston, mother of G. Keith Funston, former president of the New York Stock Exchange, died yesterday in the PutnamWeaver Nursing Home. She was 84 years old, Mrs. Funston was the widow of George E. Funston, a dentist who became a banker in Sioux Palls, S.D. Surviving besides her son are two daughters; six grandchildren and two greatgrandchildren.

title: HARRY BEHN DEAD; AN EARLY SCENARIST
description: Harry Behn, a scenarist and author of children's books, died Wednesday on a trip to Seville, Spain. He was 74 years old and lived in Greenwich, Conn.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: GARMENTS It all begins today, the city's eightday obeisance to its largest private employer, the garment industry, and we're all invited, free, to at least a few of the various celebrations. Not all, but a few.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: E. E. C. Ministers Meeting to Frame Answer to U. S.
description: COPENHAGEN, Sept. 9 (UPI) There are grounds for optimism that European Common Market nations can bury their differences this week and reach a joint position towards the United States Foreign Minister Knud B. Andersen of Denmark said today.

title: POISON SAID TO MAIM THOUSANDS IN IRAQ
description: LONDON, Sept. 9 (UPI)The Sunday Times of London said today that a shipment of mercurytreated wheat from Mexico killed and injured thousands of farmers and their families in Iraq two years ago.

title: Weiskopf Wins by 3 Shots; Nicklaus, Miller Tie for 2d
description: AKRON, Ohio, Sept. 9It was very much a personal goal for me to beat Jack Nicklaus today, said Tom Weiskopf after he won the World Series of Golf by three strokes.

title: Egg Prices Moving Upward
description: Melvin Elfenbein made a decision in 1955 that he regretted at times, but that is now making him feel pretty good, He turned his back on a Manhattan, sales career 18 years ago to become an egg farmer near Freehold, N. J.

title: Kurihara Victor in Golf
description: WIRUMA, Japan, Sept. (AP)Takashi Kurihara, a littleknown Japanese golfer, scored a birdie on the first hole in a threeway playoff today to win the 1973 Kanto open championship. Kurihara, who was scoring his first victory as a professional, defeated Fumio Tanaka and Yoshio Kusanagi. The three finished the regulation 72 holes with 284 totals.

title: Sakharov Reveals Agonies of Conscience
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 9  The agonies of the man who developed the world's most awesome weapon for the Soviet Union and then counseled against its use were revealed here this weekend.

title: SOCIALISTS PLAN FOUNDING PARLEY
description: A call for a founding convention next month for a new American socialist organization was made public here yesterday by Michael Harrington and 45 labor leaders, university professors, writers and others.

title: Remapping By Council A Hot Issue
description: City Council hearings this week on the explosive issue of its inability to redistrict itself will draw Controller Abraham D. Beanie, the Democratic candidate for Mayor; Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal, his Liberal party opponent, and Representative Berman Badillo, the Bronx DemocratLiberal who lost the primary runoff to Mr. Beame.

title: Mrs. Meir Asks for Aid to Help Russian Jews
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 Israel's Premier Golda Meir warned American and Canadian Jewish communities today that without intensified financial support in the coming months Israel would have serious problems in absorbing a heavy flow of immigrants, particularly from the Soviet Union.

title: Paul Heller Weds Jane H. Shmerler
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Sept. 9 Miss Jane Hilary Shmerler was married here today to Paul Sharfman Heller, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence B. Heller of Scarsdale. The ceremony was performed at the home here of the bride's stepfather and mother, Mr. and Mrs. Mortimer M. Reznick, by Rabbi Stuart B. Gertman.

title: 2 Attempts Reportedly Preceded Watergate Entry
description: MIAMI, Sept. 9New details of the initial breakin into the offices of the Democratic National Committee at the Watergate complex in Washington last year have been provided by participants in the operation to various law enforcement agencies here.

title: Miss Whitworth Wins Dallas Golf
description: DALLAS, Sept. 9 (UPI)Kathy Whitworth made up six strokes with a courserecord 66 today, then defeated.Mary Mills on the second hole of a playoff to win the Dallas Civitan women's golf tournament. It was her third tour triumph of the year.

title: A.M.A. Chairman Denies Misapplying Bank Funds
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 9 (UPI)Dr. John P. Kernodle, chairman of the board of trustees of the American Medical Association, said today that he was not guilty of misapplying bank funds as charged Friday in a Federal indictment.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 9The New York Mets blanked the Montreal Expos, 30, today to send their divisional championship hopes skyrocketing as they moved to within three games of the firstplace St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Mazie Cox Wed to Brink Thorne
description: WESTHAMPTON BEACH, L. I., Sept. 9Miss Mary Ann Livingston Delafield Cox and Brinkley Stimson Thorne were married here today at Sunswyck, the country home of Mr. and Mrs. Howard Ellis Cox, parents of the bride. The bridegroom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Thorne of Greenwich, Conn.

title: EDWARD F. WILLIAMS
description: WEST NEWTON, Mass., Sept. 9Edward F. Williams, a retired manager of the American Woolen Company's Assabet Mills at Maynard, Mass., died today at his home here. He was 85 years old.

title: American Swimmers Add Gold
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Sept. 9An American, Jim Montgomery, and the East German women added to their reputations tonight as the first world swimming championships ended.

title: Banker Friend of Nixon Is Target of U.S. Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9C. Arnholt Smith, the California multimillionaire who has been one of President Nixon's closest personal and political associates for more than a quarter of a century, is now the subject of intense scrutiny by Federal investigators, who have become increasingly interested in Mr. Smith's dealings with organized crime figures.

title: Newcombe Wins U.S. Tennis Title
description: John Newcombe, the Australian who won the Nationals in 1967, Wimbledon in 1971 and then took it easy the last two years, subdued Jan Kodes of Czechoslovakia yesterday in five rousing sets to win the United States Open tennis championship.

title: Bridge:
description: Beginners love to take finesses, but experts hate to do so, They search hard for ways of avoiding having to pin their hopes on the location of a particular high card.

title: Rookie Emerges as a Jet Hero
description: TAMPA, Fla. Sept. 9Linebacker didn't seem like a good position to be trying for when Rob Spicer reported to the New York Jets' camp this year. There were 12 men seeking three starting spots, nearly all of them ahead of Spicer, a ninthround draft pick from Indiana.

title: Soviet Wrestlers Win 6 Gold Medals
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Sept. 3 (Reuters)The Soviet Union won six gold medals, three silvers and one bronze to dominate the world freestyle wrestling championships that ended tonight.

title: Titanic Survivors Recall the Night to Remember
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 9 It's all right. We just grazed an iceberg.

title: Banker Friend of Nixon Is Target of U.S. Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9C. Arnholt Smith, the California multimillionaire who has been one of President Nixon's closest personal and political associates for more than a quarter of a century, is now the subject of intense scrutiny by Federal investigators, who have become increasingly interested in Mr. Smith's dealings with organized crime figures.

title: Fundamentalist Conducts A Spiritual Haven in Alps
description: HUEMOZ, SwitzerlandLarry Snyder was working in a wine factory in Oslo several years ago when a friend told him about a place in Switzerland where people can find answers to basic questions.

title: EUROPE FAVORING REVISED ALLIANCE
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Sept. 9After weeks of passing papers and ideas between capitals, America's European allies now appear ready to endorse Washington's call for new guidelines for revitalizing transAtlantic relations.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland, Sept 9 (AP)Brendan Foster of Britain won the 5,000meter run today at the European track and field championships as Lasse Viren of Finland.

title: Nurse Tells of a 4Year Ordeal As Captive of North Vietnamese
description: A German nurse who survived four years of North Vietnamese captivity recalled here yesterday how she passed the time in a wooden hut with dreams of building schools and hospitals.

title: Newcombe Wins U.S. Tennis Title
description: John Newcombe, the Australian who won the nationals in 1967, Wimbledon in 1971 and then took it easy the last two years, subdued Jan Kodes of Czechoslovakia yesterday in five rousing sets to win the United States Open tennis championship.

title: Ali 125 Pick Tonight to Avenge Loss to Norton
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Sept. 9 (AP)Muhammad Ali, his career at a key juncture, fights tomorrow night against Ken Norton, the man who beat him and broke his jaw last. March.

title: Saigon Reports Violations Of Truce by Enemy Drop
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 9 (UPI)A South Vietnamese military spokesman said that truce violations by the Communists dropped below 100 for the first time in three days today but that Government casualties rose.

title: Coliseum in Nassau Scene of 53 Arrests. In 2 Days for Drugs
description: Seventeen persons, mostly youths, were arrested at the end of a rock concert in the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, LI., Saturday night, raising to 53 the total number of misdemeanor drug arrests made at the stadium in two nights.

title: Jordanian Arrested as Spy
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 9 (UPI)Jordanian security authorities have arrested Haround Muhamid, head of the Jordanian television's Hebrewlanguage programs, on suspicion of espionage for Israel, Government sources said today.

title: Greece Closes Courts
description: ATHENS, Sept. 9 (AP)Greece's special. military tribunals and air force courts, which have tried eases since the military coup dtat of 1967, were officially closed today under an order published in the Government gazette. All cases pending before these courts were transferred to civil courts except where violations of military discipline were involved.

title: German Pointer Captures Top Award2d Day in Row
description: TARRYTOWN, N.Y., Sept. 9Two days ago, a German shorthaired pointer, Ch. Gretchenhof Columbia River, was flown east from California, along with his owner, Dr. Charles P. Smith of Hayward, and his handler, Joyce Shellenbarger. Yesterday, the 4yearold led 2,087 dogs at Somerset Hills in New Jersey and today he paced a field of 2,595 at the Westchester Kennel. Club's 56th show at Lyndhurst. It was Traveler's 20th award.

title: In a Bustling River Port in Mali, Fishermen, Farmers and Nomads Converge
description: MOPTI, MaliMana Konta cannot see most of the bustling riverport, city of Mopti during the day because his openfront straw hut faces the broad Niger River and provides only a distant view of a fishing village and the dwindling encampment of Tuareg cattle herders who fled drought and famine.

title: Kennedy Center Names Special Aide for Drama
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9The Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts is reaching cautiously to embrace those who believe it should serve more than just a rich, white, middleaged audience with an appetite for traditional theater, the classics and bigname stars.

title: Giants' Signs Are Encouraging From Perfect Exhibition Mark
description: A winning attitude, an effective outside running game, the absence of turnovers and defensive stability were the most promising elements to emerge from the New York Giants' perfect exhibition season, coach Alex Webster observed yesterday.

title: NONALIGNED WARN MAJOR COUNTRIES
description: ALGIERS, Sept. 9A major portion of the underdeveloped world closed a fiveday conference here today with a warning to the big powers not to make decisions without consulting it with a condemnation of Israel, but without agreement on relations between the poor world and the two superpowers.

title: Italy's North Chides South Over Cholera
description: ROME, Sept. 9The cholera epidemic in Italy's south has shocked the nation.

title: About the Mets:
description: Tom Seaver left the team immediately after yesterday's game for New York. He is scheduled to have stitches removed on the minor buttock mole operation he underwent last week. The ace righthander will rejoin his teammates in Philadelphia tomorrow... Willie Mays, who had not started since last Monday because rival managers have been throwing righthanded pitchers against the New Yorkers, was back inaction yesterday, but he almost made a quick exit. In charging for Felipe Alou's pop foul in the first inning, the Say Hey Kid went crashing into the metal railing fronting on the Mets' dugout. Willie spent two minutes catching his breath and then returned to action... The Mets have a day off today and will spend most of in Montreal. They will leave in midafternoon for the Quaker City.... Jerry Koosman, Jon Matlack and Seaver probably will be the starters in the series with the Phillies, starting tomorrow night. They are expected to be opposed by Jim Lonborg, Wayne Twitchell and Ken Brett in that order.

title: 6 DEAD IN WRECKAGE OF A JET IN ALASKA
description: COLD BAY, Alaska, Sept. (UPI)  The wreckage of chartered cargo jet was found today on the side of a mountain that it struck yesterday while attempting to land in fog and drizzle. The Coast Guard said all six persons aboard the plane were killed in the crash.

title: Setback Is Seen in Credit Market Rally
description: Can the fourweekold bondmarket rally continue in the face of the biggest jump in wholesale prices since 1946 and of the Federal Reserve's decision to increase some reserve requirements?

title: Louis Lozowick, Graphic Artist Honored by Whitney Show, Dies
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Sept. 9Louis Lozowick, a graphic artist of the precisionist school, primarily known for his lithographs of New York City, died today in Orange Memorial Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 62 Massel Terrace.

title: City SchoolUnit Head Quits
description: The New York City Educational Construction Fund has announced the resignation of Daniel Z. Nelson, its executive director since the fund was created by the State Legislature in 1966 to build public schools in combination with residential and commercial buildings. An official of the fund said Mr. Nelson had asked to leave to take a position in private industry.

title: ExSurgeon General ChargesChaos in Nixon Health Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9Dr. Jesse L. Steinfeld, former Surgeon General of the United States Public Health Service under President Nixon, said today that the Administration had been dragging its feet in implementing medical programs needed by the country and that Federal health affairs were in a kind of chaos.

title: Milk Prices Expected To Rise After Sept. 16
description: TRENTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)Milk in New Jersey will cost as much as eight cents more than the current $1.10 a gallon beginning next Sunday, the state's Division of Dairy Industry said yesterday, as milk producers are allowed to raise their prices to dealers.

title: Allende's Opponents Press Demand for His Resignation
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 9 (UPI)The provincial leaders of Chile's opposition Christian Democratic party today urged their national leadership to demand the resignation of President Salvador Allende Gossens and call for national elections.

title: The Great Drug RipOff
description: On the fifth floor of a warehouse on Saint Anns Avenue in the slums of the South Bronx, a bulky black woman who directs one of New York City's largest drug treatment programs looked angrily across her desk the other day, pawing at the piles of papers, plucking out records and pieces of correspondence here and there.

title: Long Boret Heads for U.N. To Parry Sihanouk Moves
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Sept, 9Foreign Minister Long Boret of Cambodia left today for United Nations headquarters in New York, where he hoped to blunt diplomatic initiatives by the former Cambodian chief of state, Prince Norodom Sihanouk.

title: INTERNATIONAL LEAGUE
description: SEMIFINAL PLAYOFFS

title: FOREST FIRE PERILS TINY COAST RESORT
description: A Pacific Coast resort development was threatened yesterday by the worst of four forest fires that burned out of control through 21,000 acres of forest land in Northern California, according to United Press International.

title: RUTGERS OPENING COOK, A NEW UNIT
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Sept. 9 Classes for 1,700 students begin tomorrow at Rutgers University's newest multipurpose undergraduate unit, Cook College, an attempt to turn an agriculture school with 1,000 students into a broadbased liberalarts institution with more than 3,000 undergraduates.

title: 1,100 Princeton Freshmen Are Arriving...and Waiting
description: PRINCETON, Sept. 9About 1,100 Princeton University freshmen began arriving this weekend for the opening of another academic year.

title: Senators Plan to Shorten New Wafergate Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9The Senate Watergate committee, apparently frustrated in its crosscountry search for fresh revelations about 1972 campaign sabotage, intends to abbreviate its hearings when they resume later this month.

title: CITY SCHOOLS OPEN TODAY WITH ROLLS DOWN AGAIN A BIT
description: The city school system will start the fall term this morning with a new Chancellor at central headquarters, new community boards in the decentralized districts, an expanded force of security officers in the school and, for the first time in recent years, some cautious optimism over the new school, year.

title: Monetary Fund Reports Poor Nations Have Gained
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9The boom in the industrialized courttries, soaring commodity prices and heavy inflows of private capital combined to give the developing countries their best payments balances on record in 1972 and early 1973, the International Monetary Fund reported today.

title: Kosygin to Visit Belgrade
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Sept. 9Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin of the Soviet Union will pay an official visit to Yugoslavia in the second half of September, it was announced here today. His visit is expected to include discussion of issues raised at the conference of nonaligned countries in Algeria.

title: MILES'S EXPRESS IN CENTRAL PARK
description: If anybody thought for a minute that the massively bassheavy, repetitively inexorable kind of bluesrock epitomized by Cream and Jimi Hendrix was in decline, he should have heard the Buddy Miles Express Friday night at the Schaefer Festival in Central Park.

title: COX SAID TO WANT 6 IN COAST CASE CITED
description: C.B.S. News reported last night that the special Watergate prosecutor, Archibald Cox, was expected to ask this week for a half dozen indictments for conspiracy in the burglary of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist's office in Los Angeles last Sept. 17.

title: Peterson's Car First in Italian Prix
description: MONZA, Italy, Sept. 9 (AP) Ronnie Peterson of Sweden won the Grand Prix of Italy auto race in a Lotus today, while Jackie Stewart of Scotland clinched his third world driving title.

title: Actress Auctions Tropical Plants
description: Each Wednesday evening at 7:30 the trucking bay of an old cereal factory here is transformed into an auction gallery where information about plants is dispersed like so many grains of pollen before they are sold to the highest bidder.

title: A Socialist Caucus Denounces Gibson And His EnemiesBaraka and Imperiale
description: NEWARK, Sept. 9  Wher nine members of the socialistoriented National Caucus of Labor Committees were arrested during a melee in the City Council chambers here last week, an aide to Mayor Kenneth Gibson wryly noted that it looks as though every. body running for Mayor is try. ing to make his reputation on the steps of City Hall.

title: Republican Leaders See Drop
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP)  Republican party leaders, meeting for the first time since the Watergate scandal erupted, see a sharp drop in Vice President Agnew's Presidential prospects and an upsurge of interest in Senator Howard H. Baker Jr. of Tennessee, Gov. Ronald Reagan of California and former Treasury Secretary John B, Connally.

title: Princess Anne Going Home
description: KIEV, U.S.S.R., Sept 9 (Reuters)Princess Anne of Britain, thrown heavily from her horse at the European equestrian championships here yesterday, will fly home tomorrow with a suspected broken collarbone. She appeared here today with her arm in a sling.

title: Italy's North Chides South Over Cholera
description: ROME, Sept. 9The cholera epidemic in Italy's south has shocked the nation.

title: 2 Meetings on Oil Shortage
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (UPI) A house subcommittee will start public hearing this week to explore the possibility of using geothermal energy to solve the fuel oil shortage. At the same time, representatives of 700 independent oil dealers from the Northeast will meet to discuss the threat of a heating oil shortage this winter.

title: No tropic Storms Feared
description: MIAMI, Sept. 9 (UPI)The National Hurricane Center in Miami said today that two weak, low pressure areas in the tropics were not expected to develop much more.

title: BOSTON U. FACULTY WANTS R.O.T.C. BACK
description: Boston University's faculty has voted to ask for a return of the Reserve Officer Training Corps on its campus, three years after student riots forced the university to expel the military training program.

title: CITY SCHOOLS OPEN TODAY WITH ROLLS DOWN AGAIN A BIT
description: The city school system will start the fall term this morning with a new Chancellor at central headquarters, new community boards in the decentralized districts, an expanded force of security officers in the school and, for the first time in recent years, some cautious optimism over the new school year.

title: ExSurgeon General Charges Chaos in Nixon Health Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 9Dr. Jesse L. Steinfeld, former SurgeonGeneral of the United States Public Health Service under President Nixon, said today that the Administration had been dragging its feet in implementing medical programs needed by the country and that Federal health affairs were in a kind of chaos.

title: 3 Die in Hungarian Mine
description: BUDAPEST, Sept. 9 (AP)Three miners were killed today in a coal mine near Komlo in southern Hungary when a rock face collapsed and buried them. Three miners were killed Thursday in a dolomite mine in northeast Hungary by a similar collapse.

title: GASOLINE STABLE AS CEILINGS SHIFT
description: The Phase 4 price ceilings started at the nation's 220,000 gasoline stations yesterday with little immediate effect on prices

title: HUGHES WILL JOIN 2 PRAYER GROUPS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 Senator Harold E. Hughes, Democrat of Iowa, who recently announced his intention to retire from the Senate to become a lay religious worker, will be joining two organizations that have the single goal of spreading the Prayer Breakfast Movement.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Today, Sept. 10

title: Nassau Polo Team Beats Suffolk, 64
description: BETHPAGE, L.I., Sept. 9Paced by Paul Rizzo's three goals, the Nassau polo team defeated Suffolk, 64, today at Bethpage State Park. Fred Braunstein also tallied three times to lead Suffolk.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Traveler Takes Horse Show Title
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Sept. 9Mrs, Diane Ward's Traveler was shut out of the ribbons in the final class, but piled up enough points in three earlier tests to win the amateurowner championship today at the final session of the North Shore horse show.

title: Sunday Trot Races Open at Monticello And Bettors Show Their Midweek Form
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Sept. 9For the first time since man had a difference of opinion on the merits of 11 horse, Sunday parimutuel racing came today to the New York metropolitan area.

title: Fire Destroys Vacant Mill
description: EAST WEYMOUTH, Mass., Sept. 9 (AP)A threealarm the destroyed a vacant threestory woolen mill here last night. No serious injuries were reported. The cause of the fire was under investigation.

title: Air and Sea Search Goes On For Dina Merrill's Son Off L. I.
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I., Sept. 9Rescuers in boats and helicopters searched all day today for David Post Rumbough, 23yearold son of Dina Merrill, the actress, and her first husband, Stanley M. Rumbough Jr., the New York industrialist.

title: Coconuts Enrich Philippine Economy
description: CALUAN, the Philippines, Aug. 31The coconut harvest has been good for Mrs. Arcadia Simiano. It will help her add a small rice marketing business to her banana store.

title: CONNALLY VIEWED BY G.O.P. ON COAST
description: SAN DIEGO, Sept. 9John B. Connally came up from Texas this weekend to let a convention of 1,600 California Republicans size up his newly acquired Presidential credentials alongside those of Gov. Ronald Reagan.

title: Samuels Again Declares Gubernatorial Intentions
description: NEW PALTZ, N. Y., Sept. 9 (AP)Howard J. Samuels, head of New York City's Offtrack Betting Corporation, said today that he planned to seek the Democratic nomination for Governor next year.

title: New Part of the Mideast Problem: U.S. Oil Supplies
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9Despite the Administration's efforts to separate Middle East politics from United States oil supplies, the two problems have become unmistakably intertwined.

title: No Place Like Maryland
description: BETHESDA, Md.  What's with Maryland, my Maryland?

title: Israel Presses Other Nations To Denounce Arab Missiles
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 9Foreign Minister Abba Eban said today that he had instructed Israeli representatives in various capitals to demand the condemnation of Arab guerrillas over an incident in Rome last week.

title: Effectiveness of U.N., 28, Is at an Ebb
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Sept. 9Twentyeight years after its founding, the United Nations, once an organization bright with promise, has by every available measure fallen to a low estate.

title: Candida Covino, A Horsewoman, Becomes Bride
description: NORTH CALDWELL, N. J., Sept. 9Miss Candida Marie Covino and Merrell Kerby Saunders 2d were married here today in Notre Dame Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. John Murphy.

title: Smokey Bear's Booses Now Say Natural Fires Help the Forests
description: SMOOT, Wyo., Sept. 9Has Smokey Bear been fibbing to us all this time?

title: Inouye Doubts Committee Needs Tapes From Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (AP) Senator Daniel K. Inouye, member of the Senate Watergate committee, said today that the controversial White House tape recordings of President Nixon's conversations were not essential to the committee's investigation.

title: S. N. Behrman, 80, Dies; Playwright and Author
description: S. N. Behrman, a reigning Broadway playwright for almost 40 years, died yesterday, apparently of heart failure, at his apartment at 1185 Park Avenue. He was 80 years old.

title: Ryan's Time Running Out
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 9Nolan Ryan, who may have been rained out of his best chance in Kansas City Friday, resumes his pursuit of Sandy Koufax's strikeout record when he pitches against the Chicago White Sox tomorrow night for the California Angeles at Anaheim.

title: Patricia McBride Is Wed
description: PARIS, Sept. 9Patricia McBride of the New York City Ballet was married yesterday to JeanPierre Bonnefous, who is a ballet dancer with the Paris Opera. The civil ceremony was held in La Clayette, a village in the Burgundy region.

title: Turner Still Expecting to Come Out on Top
description: ORLANDO, Fla.,Glenn W. Turner, the millionaire Florida franchiser who has been involved in something of a legal chess match with state and Federal law enforcement agencies for more than five years over his unorthodox business practices, now appears to be backed into a corner and close to checkmate.

title: Effectiveness of U.N., 28, Is at an Ebb
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Sept. 9Twentyeight years after its founding, the United Nations, once an organization bright with promise, has by every available measure fallen to a low estate.

title: Park Slope Man Shot Dead; 2 Gunmen Escape in Car
description: A 28yearold man was found dead of three bullet wounds outside a bar and grill in the Park Slope section of Brooklyn last night after what the police said had been a dispute involving two other men who escaped in a car.

title: Jackson's Leg Is Injured
description: OAKLAND, Sept, 9 (AP)Reggie Jackson, Oakland A's outfielder, was admitted to Merritt Hospital today with a pulled lateral hamstring musele in the right leg, doctors said, Jackson was injured in last night's game against the Texas Rangers in running from first to third base.

title: U.S. SCIENCE BODY CAUTIONS SOVIET ON SAME CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9The National Academy of Sciences warned Soviet authorities today that the arrest or further harassment of Andrei D. Sakharov, the outspoken Soviet physicist, could lead to a curtailment of American scientific cooperation with the Soviet Union.

title: PRESIDENT URGES NATION HELP KEEP HIS OFFICE STRONG
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 President Nixon appealed today to the American people to help him resist the encroachments of Congress on the powers of the Presidency.

title: Dave Anderson
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Sept. 9In, the quiet of his San Diego hospital room nearly six months ago, his mouth clamped by the wires in his broken jaw, Muhammad Ali looked up at his trainer, Angelo Dundee.

title: R. M. Steuer Marries Miss Forchheimer
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Sept. 9  Miss Audrey Pauline Forchheimer, who graduated from Goucher College and received a mister's degree in library science from Columbia University, was married here today to Richard Marc Steuer, a graduate of Hofstra University and the Columbia Law School.

title: Advice From Evers
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Sept. 9 (UPI)Charles Evers, the black Mayor of Fayette, Miss., advised black political candidates in Kentucky to gain the political support of the preachers. If they say vote for old Evers, the congregation will vote, he told a workshop for black political candidates at the University of Louisville yesterday. If they say don't vote, Evers is sunk.

title: No Undue Haste
description: With the Senate's Watergate Committee hearings due to resume next week, there are pressures on the committee to speed up its work in order to conclude the hearings by Nov. 1. Much of this clamor is partisan and selfserving. Senator Robert Dole, the former chairman of the Republican National Committee, has introduced a resolution calling upon the committee to bar television cameras. Since Senator Dole faces a hard fight for reelection in Kansas next year and the Watergate hearings do not generate helpful publicity for his campaign, his eagerness to get the hearings off camera is readily understandable.

title: Oil on the Rocks
description: The Department of the Interior's elaborate statement on the environmental impact tO be expected from oil shale mining does notand should notprescribe a headlong rush to lease sizable public lands for oil extraction by that method. The statement is designed to cover no more than a prototype industry in which six tracts would be leased for the production of 250,000 barrels of oil a day. Before any expansion could take place, another impact statement would have to be made, based on the monitored environmental effects of this experimental program.

title: Surprised Holdup Men Back In and Back Out
description: Two policemen saw three men armed with shotguns leaving a Brooklyn social club yesterday. The men, who were coming out the front door of the Mark II Club at 668 Nostrand Avenue in the BedfordStuyvesant section, saw the policemen and hurriedly backed in. The policemen called for reinforcements.

title: Upstate Storeowner Finds An Apparent Burglar Dead
description: PLATTSBURGH, N. Y., Sept. 9 (UPI)When James Baker opened his drugstore here today he found that the place had been broken into and that the apparent burglar was dead on the cellar floor.

title: Barbara Fisher Bride Of Walter Williamson
description: Miss Barbara Alice Fisher, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Charles Fisher of New York, was married here yesterday to Walter Williamson, son of Mrs. Zarah Williamson, also of New York, and the late Mr. Williamson. Rabbi Ronald Sobel performed the ceremony at the Plaza.

title: Roundup: N.L. Race Tightens
description: The St. Louis Cardinals and the Pittsburgh Pirates played yesterdayas if neither team wanted to win the National League Eastern Division title. Both lost on lateinning home runs.

title: CANADA IS MAKINGOIL POLICY SHIFT
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 9  The (Canadian Government is making some basic changes in its national oil policy, and their effect could be to worsen substantially the already drastic energy shortage in the United States.

title: ACADEMIC GOALS DIFFER FOR SEXES
description: A survey of college seniors throughout the country has disclosed that 44.6 per cent of the men but only 29.4 per cent of the women planned to go to graduate and professional schoolseven though the women generally had better grades.

title: A Civilized Man of the Theater
description: Everyone who knew S. N. Behrman will be desolated by the news that he is dead. At first the news seemed incredible. For the smiling, friendly, humorous personality of this playwright has been a beloved creature of life in the theater for nearly half a century. It became part of the theater in 1927 when Lynn Fontanne, Alfred Lunt, Margalo Gillmore and Earle Larimore appeared in the Theater Guild production of The Second Man. A civilized man came into the theater with a light and jaunty step. During the next quarter of a century the finest American comedies of manners followed: A Brief Moment, Biography, Wine of Choice and some radiant adaptations  Amphitryon 38, Serena Blandish, Jaand the Colonel.

title: 3 Illegal Stories Added to Building; City Orders a Halt
description: A Manhattan builder who, without city authorization, added an extra three stories onto a 33story luxury apartment house being erected on East 34th Street has been ordered to stop work by incensed Buildings Department officials.

title: Hotel Fire Kills Four
description: BATH, Me., Sept. 9 (AP)Four persons perished early today when a fastmoving fire swept through the Hotel Sedgwick. They were not identified.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 10, 1973

title: Books of The Times
description: SAINT JACK. By Paul Theroux. 247 pages. Houghton Mifflin. $5.95.

title: $55MILLION PAID FOR SCHOOL LOAN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 UPI) An estimated 60,000 college and trade school students have defaulted on $55.2million in federally guaranteed loans over the last five years and the Government has recovered only $3.2million, according to the Office of Education.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Power Company Appeals Fish Ruling The Jersey Central Power & Light Company, which was fined $6,945 for killing fish at the site of its nuclear generating plant in Lacey Township, has decided to appeal the decision.

title: Lefkowitz Office Studying Futures Trading Practices
description: The office of Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz is conducting an investigation into the trading of commodity futures and options.

title: American Swimmers Add Gold
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Sept. 9An American, Jim Montgomery, and the East German women added to their reputations tonight as the first world swimming championships ended.

title: PRESIDENT URGES NATION HELP KEEP HIS OFFICE STRONG
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 President Nixon appealed today to the American people to help him resist the encroachments of Congress on the powers of the Presidency.

title: 2 IN MAYOR'S RACE CHIDE EACH OTHER
description: State Senator John J. Marchi. called Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal a Tammany Haill pussycat yesterday and Mr. Blumenthal said Mr. Marchi was such a lackadaisical campaigner that he needs a little more orange juice.

title: Delhi's Needless Irritant
description: Six weeks ago a senior Indian Government official in New Delhi called in the representatives of the American press to declare, We are trying to improve our relations with the United States. He added, There is no anger or irritation on our part.

title: Books as an Art Form Through Five Centuries On View at the Morgan
description: They are not the best sellers. They are simply the best.

title: Nader Asserts Oil Industry Forced Crisis for Pipeline
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 (UPI) Ralph Nader accused the oil industry today of deliberately contriving a shortterm oil crisis to force construction of the Alaskan pipeline.

title: TV: Woman's Place Vies With Miss America
description: If only through an accident of scheduling, a touch of irony wriggled its way into television Saturday night. As the Miss America Pageant prepared to glide down the network runway of the National Broadcasting Company, an hourlong documentary on the American Broadcasting Company was provoking intelligent questions about the roles women play, or are forced to play.

title: Women and Pensions
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9  As the Senate begins this week to consider bills to reform private pension plans, most people are only beginning to grasp that these plans work on the same principle as a lottery: many losers and few winners.

title: $55MILLION PAID FOR SCHOOL LOANS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 9 UPI)  An estimated 60,000 college lnd trade school students have lefaulted on $55.2million in federally guaranteed loans over the last five years and the Government has recovered only $3.2 million, according to the office of Education.

title: FIVEMONTH CEILING ON BEEF PRICES ENDS
description: The beef price ceiling ended at midnight yesterday after more than five months of Government controls. Today also marks the start of new food regulations that will allow producers, processors and retailers to pass on to the consumer increases in nonagricultural costs.

title: gunfire at Kompong Cham Called Too I mense to Retrieve the Dead
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Monday, Sept. 10A wounded soldier who, has been fighting for the last two weeks at the provincial capital of Rompong Cham arrived here Saturday night and described a scene of Carnage in the city.

title: Nassau Polo Team Beats Suffolk, 64
description: BETHPAGE, L.I., Sept. 9Paced by Paul Rizzo's three goals, the Nassau polo team defeated Suffolk, 6.4, today at Bethpage State Park. Fred Braunstein also tallied three times to lead Suffolk.

title: Snead Again Wins World Senior Title
description: PORTSMOUTH, Va., Sept. 9 (AP)  Sam Snead won his second straight world seniors' golf championship today, defeating Australia's Kel Nagle with a 20foot birdie putt on the fifth hole of a suddendeatn playoff.

title: Personal Finance
description: A handful of insurers, including two that are controlled by major automobile manufacturers, are quietly attempting to determine whether the American public is interested in purchasing a relatively new concept in coverage  a lowcost insurance policy that pays off when an automobile suffers a mechanical breakdown.

title: North Korean Anniversary
description: TOKYO, Sept, 9 (AP)North Koreans celebrated their country's 25th anniversary today and attributed their progress to President Kim II Sung. Official North Korean dispatches received in Tokyo said Marshal Kim received thunderous applause when he appeared at a mass rally in I he Noll li capital, Pyongyand.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Welfare Waste Estimated in Millions

title: 20,000 Throng Ann Arbor For 2Day Jazz and Blues Fete
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Sept. 9 Silverhaired Count Basle stepped up to the microphone Friday night, smiled a beneficent smile and welcomed 14,000 cheering young people to the 1973 Ann Arbor Blues and Jazz Festival:

title: Fans Like Grass Courts
description: By a voice vote, the 15,241 fans at Forest Hills overwhelmingly urged yesterday that the grass courts be retamed by the West Side Tennis Club. The club has announced plans to install surface similar to clay for the United States Open tents championships next year.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BELMAR, Sept. 9It was back in 1941, at the start of World War II, when Capt. Charles Siegler started to send his fishing boat, the Marie S, on halfday excursions. Few people around the Belmar dockside thought the practice would last.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Proposal for New School Splits Pt. Pleasant Beach
description: POINT PLEASANT BEACH, Sept. 9A Board of Education proposal to spend $4.9million to build a new high school here has turned neighbor against neighbor and has made political activists of people who normally do not get involved.

title: Return of a HasBeen
description: It may have seemed a little businesslike to some people. No Ilie Nastase clowning it up on the center court. No Bobby Riggs hustling around, teasing the girls. No bright amateurs making a run at the world's best tennis professionals. Just Jan Kodes of Czechoslovakia and John David Newcombe of Australia playing for $25,000 and the United States Open title at Forest Hills.

title: Jersey Jail Is Calm Again
description: TRENTON, Sept. 9 (UPI)Conditions returned to normal at. the Mercer County Jail today after a protest by 17 inmates over food and medical facilities, Everything is quiet at the jail, Alfred Menkarell, a correction official, said, Conditions remain normal.
