description: The first indictment under the state's stringent new drug laws was handed up yesterday in the Bronx against two men suspected of being heroin deal ers. They were caught on Sept. 4 after a gun battle with nar cotics detectives.

title: People in Sports: Flu Costly for Chris
description: A virus infection that knocked Chris Evert out of the $40,000 Four Roses tennis classic in Charlotte, N. C., yesterday also could cost her the $22,500 top prize in the Commercial Union Grand Prix competition. With two tour naments to go in the Grand Prix, based on points for fin ishes in major tournaments of the year, Miss Evert was 95 points ahead of Evonne Goolagong. The Australian is now the favorite in the Char lotte tourney.

title: United Air Lines Reports Peak Profits
Arabs Cite Cairo Talks
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Sept. 14 Jordanian and other Arab diplo mats here charged today that Israel provoked a major air battle with Syria yesterday in an attempt to discourage the restoration of a unified Arab military, front made up of Syria, Jordan and Egypt.

title: Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn
description: MOSCOW  Following is a letter from Aleitsandr I. Solzhenitsyn, the Nobel Prizewinning novelist, propos ing Andrei. D. Saltharov, the physicist and, civil rights advocate, for the 1973 Nobel Peace Prize. This letter was first published in the Norwegian newspaper Aftenposten of Oslo.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Revolt in Steel?
description: The decision six months ago of the United Steel workers of America and ten major steel producers to adopt an experimental nostrike plan for their 1974 contract round represented one of the most encouraging labormanagement developments since World War II.

title: Vital Stretch of Route 8.0 Opens In Jersey, Ending Big Bottleneck
description: Drivers who have been wait ing for years to get onto a vital, unfinished stretch of In terstate 80 in North Jersey were literally unchained yes terday and sent speeding on their way on the sixlane ex pressway.

title: JERSEY AIDE LOSES ON KITCHEN CHECKS
description: TRENTON, Sept. 14Dr. Os car Sussman, who has ordered kitchens or bakeries in nine state institutions closed in the last three weeks because of un sanitary conditions, was told today that he did not have the power to order further clos ings.

title: Excerpts From Key Articles in the Laotian Coalition Accord
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Sept. 14  Following are excerpts from key articles in the pro locol on a coalition govern ment signed here today by the Laotian Government in Vientiane and the proCom munist Pathet Lao, as trans lated by The New York Times from an unofficial French version of the 28article text furnished by the Vientiane Government:

title: PERJURY COKED IN RACING INQUIRY
description: The parade of harness driv ers before a Federal grand jury started yesterday and when their first few hours of testi mony ended, a minor figure in the sport was charged with perjury.

title: Sally Bowles, Mayor's Aide, Becomes Bride
description: ESSEX, Conn., Sept. 14 Miss Sally Bowles and Marc S. Rosen, members of the staff of Mayor John V. Lind say of New York, were mar ried here this afternoon. Judge Douglas Wright of the Superior Court of the State of Connecticut performed the ceremony at the home of Chester Bowles, former Gov ernor of Connecticut and Un der Secretary of State, and Mrs. Bowles, parents of the bride.

title: British Treasury Bill Rate Declines at Weedy Sale
description: LONDON, Sept. 14 (Reuters) The average rate at today's tender of British Treasury bills fell to 10.9507 per cent from 10.9801 per cent a week earlier.

title: Swedish King Sinks Slowly
description: HELSINGBORG, Sweden, Sept. 14 (Reuters)The 90 yearold King Gustaf VI Adolf Was said by his doctors tonight to be sinking slowly and peace fully towards death. The doc tors said only the aged mon archs' strong heart was now prolonging his life after four major crises following a stom ach operation last month, The latest bulletin tonight said the King now had a high fever and his kidneys had virtually ceased to function.

title: Equity Financing
description: McDonald's Corporation announced yesterday that it planned to file a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission next week covering about 950,000 shares of its common stock. The offering, which had previously been announced and postponed because of general market condi tions, will be made by selling stockholders and no stock will be sold by the company. The franchise restaurant company's stock closed at 66, down 2 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Scores on WQXR
description: Scores of leading football games will be given at the end of the WQXR 6 P.M. news broadcast and in other news reports. Please do not telephone The New York Times or WQXR for scores; the calls tie up lines and in terfere with the work of the newspaper and the radio station.

title: Mrs. Allende Reported to Say She Plans to Remain in Chile
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 14 (Reu ters)The widow of the late Chilean President, Dr. Salvador Allende Gossens, has decided to stay in Chile despite an of fer of asylum in Mexico, a newspaper interviewer here said today.

title: KNEEL THREATENS BONDISSUE FIGHT
description: Theodore W. Kheel threatened yesterday to end his support of Governor Rockefeller's pro posed transportation bond issue.

title: When a Child Is Dying, the Family Must Face Life as Well as Death
description: If one wished to characterize these families, one could use words like mid dleclass and suburban. They live in roomy houses, on quiet, shaded streets. But apart from the lawns and screened porches, the patios and barbecue grills, they have something else in common: Each of the families has experienced the death of a child.

title: DualPurpose Funds
description: Following Is a weekly listing of the un audited net asset value applicable In the capital shares of dualpurpose Investment companies at close of business Friday. Also shown are closing listed market prices of best overthecounter dollartodollar asked Prices for the capital shares of each company with the perecentage difference (discount or premium) between the net asset value and the asked prices of the capital shares.

title: Gennaro Fete, an Antipasto of Food and Fun
description: The air along Mulberry Street is thick again with the aroma of Italian sausage skewered and sizzled over charcoal, of gooey pizzas and deepfried pastry stuffed with sweet cheese and ham, of molasses and honey and of hard nougat crammed with filberts and hazel nuts.

title: Biggest Airport Due to Open in Texas Soon
description: GRAPEVINE, Tex., Sept 14 ;Midway between Dallas and Fort Worth, a shotgun marriage between two civic rivals has produced a colossus of a jet port that is more than twice the size of any ever built and is likely to provide lessons to the world on how pleasant a jetport can be.

title: Jerusalem Defends Pilots
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 14  Israeli officials concluded today that, the battle fought by Israeli and Syrian jet fighters over the Mediterranean yesterday was an isolated incident rather than a serious attempt to renew hos tilities in the Middle East.

title: CHILE'S JUNTA SAYS ITKEPT U.S. IN DARK
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 14 Chile's ruling fourman junta has informed Washington that it deliberately kept its plans for a coup on Tuesday to itself to prevent any possibility of United States involvement in the overthrow of President Salvador Allende Gossens, ac cording to a Cabinetlevel of ficial of the Nixon Administra tion.

title: Cutbacks in Security Guards For Public Schools Assailed
description: Representative Edward I. Koch charged yesterday that reduction of 385 school security guards since last June could affect the safety of the city's pupils and teachers.

title: Mary Barkley Wed  To William McCaw
description: YONKERS, Sept. 14Miss Mary Kathryn Barkley, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ed ward J. Barkley, was married here this afternoon to Wil liam Blair McCaw, son of Mr. and Mrs. William J. McCaw of Doylestown, Pa. The Rev. Thomas O'Keefe performed the ceremony in St. Eugene's Roman Catholic Church, assisted by the Rev. Ernest Moritz, a Presbyterian min ister.

title: A T. & T. Courting Europeans
description: PARIS, Sept. 14For the first time, the American Tele phone and Telegraph Company has come to Europe to try to sell Europeans on the advan tages of being among the three million shareholders of the Bell System.

title: COPPER FUTURES SHOW INCREASES
description: Lack of news from Chile on copper was bullish for copper futures yesterday, and the near by months jumped the 3cents apound daily limit. Since the Allende Government was over thrown Tuesday, copper traders have been waiting for some word from the new military junta about Chilean copper pro duction and exports.

title: Fuchsberg Petitions for 2d Line On the Ballot Are Ruled Invalid
description: ALBANY, Sept. 14Secre tary of State John P. Lomenzo today ruled invalid nominating petitions by which Jacob D. Fuchsberg, the Democratic can didate for chief judge of the Court of Appeals, was seeking a second line on the Nov. 6 ballot as the candidate of the Better Courts party.

title: Revolt in Steel?
description: The decision six months ago of the United Steel workers of America and ten major steel producers to adopt an experimental nostrike plan for their 1974 contract round represented one of the most encouraging laborManagement developments since World War II.

title: Ford Research Engineer Guilty in Conspiracy Case
description: DETROIT, Sept. 14 (AP)A research engineer for the Ford Motor Company pleaded guilty in United States District Court today to a charge of conspiracy to transport stolen Ford plans for a glassmaking process.

title: New Jersey Sports,
description: PATERSON, Sept. 14That rotund, middleaged man peering through the wiremeshed backstop of your local park while a sandlot game is in progress is not a truant officer. He may be Ben Marmo, the Philadelphia Phillies' chief scout for northern New Jersey.

title: Spun Off By the Whirlwind
description: Even though history's whirlwind proved too great for him, there was something appealing about the late Salvador Allende who tried to lead Chile into Marxist Socialism by par liamentary means.

title: E. D'ARCY M'GREER
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 14E. D'Arcy McGreer, retired Canadian Am bassador to Israel, died today of cancer. He was 75 years old.

title: Books of The Times
description: The negotiable value of a woman was clearly established in primitive societies. Jacob served 14 years for Rachel, and in other tribes, an ablebodied wife was bar tered for currency or livestock. Even to day, a few females have an unerring sense of what they are worth, as sex objects or ornaments of prestige, to aging mil lionaires.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 14 (Reuters)The Federal Re serve Board said today it was proposing to permit pay ment of interest by member banks only on the minimum average balance in negotiable order of withdrawal ac counts. The board, in publishing for comment a tentative statement of proposed policies to regulate the use of NOW accounts by member banks in Massachusetts and New Hampshire, recommended a requirement that the banks concerned impose a service charge on all NOW accounts written by the depositor in excess of 10 items a month. This would not preclude service charges on the first 10 items, the Reserve said.

title: Cost of Living Unit Allows 1c Increase for Gasoline
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 14  The Cost of Living Council an nounced today that the Atlantic Richfield Company, one of the major oil companies, was roll ing back to a penny a previous ly announced increase of 2 cents in the price of heating oil.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Former State Senator James M. Turner was denied a new trial based on what he had said was new evidence that would clear him of the charge of trying to frame a fellow legislator on drug charges. The ruling was made by Superior Court Judge Arthur A. Salvatore, who presided at Turner's trial in June. During the trial Turner was found guilty. The judge said the new evidence was not credible and, in his opinion, would not result in a different verdict.

title: Plea Given in Murder Case
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., Sept. 14 (AP)Bayani Advincula, 20 years old, of Delano, pleaded not guilty today to a charge of murdering a United Farm Workers Union picket during this summer's San Joaquin Valley farm labor strife. The victim, Juan De La Cruz, 60, was shot in the heart at a picket line outside a table grape vineyard Aug. 16.

title: Bridge:
description: When a quick ruff is avail able in the dummy, few declarers look further for a line of play. But there are hands on which the ruff can be delayed with profit.

title: Basketball Transactions
description: BOSTONWaived John Laing, center.

title: Proposal for Increase in T axes Draws Stiff Opposition in the Administration
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 14The radical tax proposals that the White House said yesterday were under consideration have aroused sharp opposition with in President Nixon's official family.

title: WESLEYAN TO OPEN NEW ARTS CENTER
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., Sept. 14Wesleyan University will hold the official opening of its new $11.9million, 11building Center for the Arts tomorrow with an openhouse celebration featuring a variety of perform ances and exhibits.

title: NIXON SUPPORTER IS CALLED BY HIM
description: URBANA, Ill., Sept. 14 (UPI) Dwight E. Dobbs said today that he had had just the big gest thrill of my life when he picked up the telephone and the caller identified himself as President Nixon.

title: Wallace Signs Bill Making Newsmen Disclose Finances
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Sept. 14 (AP)Gov. George C. Wal lace signed into law tonight an ethics measure requiring news men to make financial dis closures before being allowed to cover state government.

title: 12 Narcotics Agents Plead Not Guilty in Illinois Raids
description: ALTON, Ill., Sept. 14 (UPI) Twelve narcotics agents today pleaded not guilty to charges that they had deprived 11 per sons of their constitutional rights when they entered south western Illinois homes on drug raids.

title: MONDAY ACTION SET ON GEOTEK MOTIONS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 14 United States District Judge William T. Sweigert said today he would hear motions Monday on whether the Securities and Exchange Commission should be granted a temporary re straining order preventing Geo tek Resources Fund, Inc., and associated companies from en gaging in certain activities that would further endanger the assets of its shareholders.

title: Students Get an Unscheduled Lecture From on High
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Sept. 14  Lessons at Scarsdale Junior High School were suddenly enriched today when the pilot of a hotair balloon who landed unin vited on the school grounds lectured on the craft for 15 minutes.

title: CHRYSLER STRUCK BY Ed. AS TALKS FAIL AT DEADLINE
description: DETROIT, Sept. 14  The United Auto Workers ordered a strike tonight against the Chrysler Corporation after the parties failed to agree on a new contract. The strike was called for midnight, when the old threeyear pact expired.

title: Susan Hammond Becomes a Bride
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Sept. 14Miss Susan Lewis Ham mond, daughter of Mrs. William Knapp Hammond and the late Mr. Hammond, was married here this after noon to E. Hawley Van Wyck 3d, son of Mrs. Clay ton Adelbert Farrar, also of Greenwich, and the late E. Hawley Van Wyck Jr. of Montclair, N. J.

title: Cahill Urges Transit Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 14 (AP)Governon Cahill met with the Transportation Secretary, Claude S. Brinegar, today to urge approval of New Jersey's request for a $47million grant for mass transit. We're here because we don't want anything to interfere with this applica tion for funds, Mr. Cahill said aftei the meeting. If the grant is not approved, it would be disastrous for New Jersey's largest bus line, he said.

title: Today's Football at a Glance
description: G. Paterno, Mariner coach: This year won't complain about the officials. With one of its best teams in years (on paper) Wagner may dominate Met area.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote on bill authorizing grants to state and local goy crnments for operating mass transit systems, which passed, 53 to 33, Sept. 10.

title: About the Giants:
description: Spider Lockhart, the free safety, again received the biggest round of applause at the kickoff luncheon yester day at the Americana. Norm Snead and Ron Johnson were close seconds.... Houston bought up its 500ticket allotment for tomorrow's opener, which means the Oilers will be bringing some support to Yankee Stadium.... Tomorrow's local telecast will be only the second in the memory of Wellington Mara, club president Mara's only other recollection was of the 1970 regularseason game with the Jets, which was done through the mutual consent of both teams.... The Giants sent a $70,000 check to John V. Mara Cancer Research Fund at St. Vincent's Hospital and a similar one to a Catholic Youth Organiza tion summer camp program. The checks were the result of proceeds from the kickoff luncheon, contributions and a portion of the receipts from the Aug. 26 game with the Steelers.

title: Airplane Stuck in Mud
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Sept. 14 (AP)  An Eastern Airlines twinengine DC9 skidded off the runway and stuck in the mud at Douglas Airport today after it landed in a rainstorm. There were 14 passengers and the crew on the plane, which was en route from Daytona Beach, Fla.

title: Philadelphians a Big Success In Their First Concert in China
description: PEKING, Sept. 14The first American orchestra ever to play in China since the Communists took power gave its first con cert tonight in the auditorium of the Palace of Nationalities.

title: People in Sports: Flu Costly for Chris
description: A virus infection that knocked Chris Evert out of the $40,000 Four Roses tennis classic in Charlotte, N. C., yesterday also could cost her the $22,500 top prize in the Commercial Union Grand Prix competition. With two tour naments to go in the Grand Prix, based on points for fin ishes in major tournaments of the year, Miss Evert was 95 points ahead of Evonne Goolagong. The Australian is now the favorite in the Char lotte tourney.

title: WINE TALK
description: One of Bordeaux's foremost wine merchants was in town this week and he talked about the wine scandal that is rocking his home city. It's a great tragedy, said Yves Fourault, the director of Louis Eschenauer, but it will pass. Bordeaux produces four million hectoliters of wine. What was involved here, 20,000? I don't think anyone will blame all of Bordeaux for that.

title: ClosedEnd Funds
description: Following Is a weekly listing of the net asset value of a closedend investment fund's shares as reported by the companies through The Association of ClosedEnd investment Companies at the close of business. Friday.

title: California Fossil Plan Voted
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Sept 14 (UPI)  A proposal making the sabre tooth tiger the offi cial state fossil has been passed by the legislature and sent to Gov. Ronald Reagan.

title: REVIEW HELD AIM
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 14  Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson has decided to let evidence against Vice President Agnew go to the Federal grand jury that is investigating charges of Maryland political corruption, Government sources in Washington said today.

title: Chile's Strongman
description: Before he became the new Chilean strongman, Gen. Au gusto Pinochet Ugarte scrupu lously avoided politics. His silence was in keeping with the tradition of Chile's mili tary.

title: Law on Faulty Health Devices Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 14 Faulty devices ranging from breakable artificial heart valves to baby incubators that can get dangerously hot were cited today as proof that the nation needs a law governing safety and efficacy of all such medical products.

title: Allende's Undoing: A Middle Class Stung by Declining Fortunes
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 14 I am not the President of all Chileans, Dr. Salvador Allende Gossens said a few months after taking office almost three years ago.

title: AllDay Rain Postpones YankeesOrioles Opener
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 14 The New York Yankees had an unexpected day of rest today when an allday rain fall caused the postpone ment of the opener of their fourgame series with the pacesetting Orioles. The contest will be played as part of a doubleheader Sunday.

title: GOINT OUT Guide
description: EVER MORE Edgar Allan Poe lived in Greenwich Vil lage and spent at least two summers, in 1843 and 1844, estivating on West 84th Street and Broadway (a plaque is on the northwest corner), where he wandered over to the Hudson and put his thoughts to what became The Raven.

title: SHOP TALK
description: For those women who couldn't leave the house without being madeup and scented by Estee Lauder, there's a new goodie in store. Locked up in Mrs. Lauder's very feminine office in the General Motors building, there's a new perfume.

title: INDIAN ARMY CALLED IN RIOTS IN 2 STATES
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 14 (Reu ters)The army was called out in two Indian states today after Widespread rioting.

title: F.T.C. Accuses Auto Dealers Of Selling Used Cars as New
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 14 (AP) The Federal Trade Commis sion moved today against five Washingtonarea automobile dealers it says represented used cars as new, sometimes concealing damage to the cars.

title: Penn State Is Off and Running
description: If you have to score many points in your first game of the season, the chances are you're in trouble, said Coach Joe Paterno, whose Penn State football teams have a record of five victories and two losses in opening games.

title: Nowadays Everybody Gets Into the Act
description: Suzanne Castelein, a 10 yearold fifth grader with Rapunzellike long blond hair, was chosen best model twice by her peers.

title: Nancy Hanks Named for New Term at Endowment
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 14  You're here, President Nixon told Nancy Hanks at a formal ceremony nominating her for a second term as chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts, because you have been able to get a 900 per cent in crease out of Congress, in funds for the arts since 1970.

title: Medical Monitoring Office Chief Quits, Charging Lack of Support
description: WASHINGTON, Sept 14  The head of a new Federal pro gram intended to monitor the quality of services provided by doctors and hospitals resigned today and charged that the Ad ministration had not provided him with resources and sup port.

title: A nation of immigrants
description: Eslyn has a lilting Jamaican accent and round, laughing eyes, the kind that usually stare out at you from travel ads showing beaches so idyllic you wonder where they are because when you go there you can never find them. She came to this country to make enough money to live well back in her sunny land some day. At home there is little opportunity.

title: Costs Force Cut In FamilySize Apartments On the West Side
description: Apartment house developers have all but given up building twobedroom and threebedroom, units in luxury buildings on the West Side in favor of more rentable studio and onebed room apartments.

title: Schools Cut By $1Million In Dispute Over Tests
description: The refusal of Brooklyn Community School District 19 to accede to the demands of the Federal Office of Edu cation that two district schools take part in a series of restandardization tests aimed at monitoring the re sults of government aid, has resulted in the loss of near ]y $1million in Federal grants.

title: Tigers Win As Coleman Gains No. 20
description: DETROIT, Sept. 15 (UPJ) Gates Brown's threerun double in the eighth inning today gave Joe Coleman his second straight 20victory season and enabled John Hiller to set an American League record for saves as the Detroit Tigers beat the Milwaukee Brewers, 43.

title: Romulo Challenges France
description: MANILA, Sept. 15 (Reuters) Foreign Secretary Carlos P. Romulo suggested today that nuclear tests be held on the French Riviera as a tourist at tractionif the blasts were as safe as France has said. The Philippines has protested recent French nuclear tests in the Pa cific.

title: Doubled Budget and Upsurge of Parents' Interest Contribute to Steady Growth of P. S. A. L. Football
Theater: Bergman's Misanthrope
description: In America we think of Ingmar Bergman as a film director, but in Europe, espe cially in his native Scandi navia, he is regarded equally as a theater director. He has his own kind of repertory company in Swedena com pany that has, by the way, become a collection of inter national stars through their participation in Bergman's filmsbut occasionally works elsewhere in Europe.

title: 600,000 Pontiacs Recalled Over FuelLine Fire Hazard
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Sept. 15 (UPI)  A Pontiac spokesman said yesterday that the com pany was recalling 600,000 cars, about twothirds of its 1973 model production in the United States, to correct a potential fire hazard in a fuel line.

title: U.S. Envoy in Sudan
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Sept. 15 (UPI)William D. Brewer, the new United States Ambas sador to the Sudan, arrived today to succeed Cleo A. Noel, who was assassinated last March at the Saudi Arabian Em bassy here by members of the Palestinian Black September organization.

title: The Anatomy of the Mustang II
description: DETROITWith consumer demand for small cars surg ing, the Ford Motor Company is pushing hard this fall with the only genuinely new de sign of the 1974 models, the subcompact Mustang II.

title: Homesteaders Combating Urban Blight
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Sept. 15 At 61 years of age, burly, barrelchested. James Hadrick has been a number of things carpenter, bricklayer, prize fighter, longshoreman, husband and father of 11.

title: FAVORABLE RATING GIVEN U.S. IN POLL
description: Despite the view that a wide range of unsolved problems cur rently face the nation, the American people overwhelming ly give the United States a favorable rating, the latest Gallup Poll says.

title: The World
description: It is inconceivable that any government in England can entertain for a moment a pro posal that, by destroying our perfect insularity, will make a breach in the natural defense of our island fortressa defense for which we cannot be too grateful to a merciful providence.

title: Villanova Overcome By UMass
description: AMHERST, Mass., Sept. 15 (UPI)Fred Kelliher, pressed into duty in the third period, threw a 5yard touchdown pass and then tossed for a 2point conversion in the final 90 seconds today to lead the University of Massa chusetts to a 2120 victory Villanova.

title: SWEATER MEN
description: The second best thing about sweaters (the first is that they never really go out of style) is the enor mity of their price range. Those shown here go from $12 to $135.

title: Belgians and Dutch, Burdened by Roles In NATO, Planning Changes in Military
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 15Belgium and the Netherlands, faced with growing public discontent about their military contributions to the North Atlantic Treaty Or ganization, plan to make major changes in the structure of their armies in the near future.

title: DRUGRAID HOUSE IS STILL A WRECK
description: MASSAPEQUA, L. I., Sept. 15  It is 15 months since Treasury Department agents swooped down on the split level ranchstyle house of John Conforti and wrecked the house and property in a vain search for $4million in profits from smuggled heroin believed to have been hidden there. The eightroom house is still Unin habitable.

title: NEW STRIFE NEARS IN GRAPE DISPUTE
description: LIVINGSTON, Calif., Sept. 15 This dusty town of 3,000 people in the middle of, the San Joaquin Valley, California's ag ricultural heartland, prides it self on being the place where the sun ripens the fruit of pros perity. But it is currently the scene of a bitter dispute be tween the United Farm Work ers and the E. & J. Gallo Winery, the nation's largest winemaker:

title: Wiretap Procedure It Depends On the Interpreter
description: MIAMI BEACHThere may be no more heatedly disputed area of American law than the statutes gov erning the use of covert electronic surveillance by policemen at all levels of government to gather investigative information for evidence in criminal cases.

title: Secretariat Not 100%, But Turcotte's Satisfied
description: In the paddock before yes terday's $250,000 Marlboro Cup at Belmont Park, Lucien Laurin drew Ron Turcotte and Eddie Maple to his side for the kind of riding instruc tions few trainers ever get to issue.

title: Last Photos of Freud's Vienna Office on Display
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I. Vienna in May, 1938, was not a healthy place for a Jew to be. The Nazis had just taken over Austria and antiSemi tism had become offical gov ernmental policy.

title: MARKET WILL AID ITALY'S POOR SOUTH
description: ROME, Sept. 15Italy is due to receive substantial aid for her poor South from the Euro pean Economic Community, but she wants more.

title: ENATE LIBERALS WILL OPPOSE AID TO SAIGON POLICE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15  Senate liberals are planning a major floor fight to delete all support for South Vietnam's police force and prison system from the pending foreign aid bill.

description: The 13th consecutive Old Glory horse sale, featuring some of harness racing's finest yearlings, will be held nett. Saturday at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Junta in Chile Reported Killing Many of Allende's Supporters
description: Amnesty International, citing what it described as reliable sources in Chile, said yesterday that the military junta there was systematically arresting and executing supporters of the deposed President Dr. Salvador Allende Gossens, and that hundreds of industrial work ers had already been killed.

title: Secretariat Sets Record In $250,000 Race Here
description: Secretariat won the $250, 000 invitation race yesterday at Belmont Park with a worldrecord time of 1:45 2/5 for the mile and an eighth. Second in the newly estab lished Marlboro Cup was Rive Ridge, his Meadow Sta ble mate, 3 lengths behind. Third was Cougar II.

title: Lehigh K.C. Gives Best To Papillon
description: MACUNGIE, Pa., Sept. 15  A highflying butterfly soared to victory at Macun gie Memorial Park today. But this time it was a butter fly of the canine variety and she was Ch. Star Heir's Crown Jewel, a papillon, owned by Paul and Lorraine Weick of Akron, Ohio.

title: Two Defense Aides Resign
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15 (AP)  The White House reported that President Nixon had ac cepted the resignations of two Assistant Secretaries of De fense. The President voiced gratitude Thursday for what he termed the distinguished serv ice of Dr. Eberhardt Rechtin land Dr. Richard S. Wilbur.

title: Medderses Tell Their Story: From Rags to Riches to Rags
description: MEMPHIS, Sept. 15For six years, until the money bubble burst, Ernest and Margaret Medders lived the way rich Texans are supposed to live.

title: SAN MARINO LIFTS CURBS ON WOMEN
description: SAN MARINO, Sept. 15 (AP) The allmale Grand Council, the governing body of the world's oldest and smallest re public, has adopted a law end ing some of its traditional dis crimination against women.

title: LUTHERAN SYNODS ADD NEW SCHOOLS
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Sept. 15At a time when many parochial schools are closing, a number of new schools were opened this fall in various parts of the country by the two conserva tive synods that operate more than 90 per cent of the Lu theran schools in the nation.

title: Where Dinosaurs Made Their Mark
description: STALKING the wild dinosaur is not quite the same as hunting for asparagus or mushroomsthere's nothing left to eat, you under stand. But setting your foot down in fossilized footprint left behind when dino was out taking the air some 200 million years agowell, that can pro vide food for the mind.

title: Camera World
description: THE New School for So cial Research, 66 West 12th Street, in coopera tion with its affiliate, the Parsons School of Design, has an expanded photography curriculum this fall and is of fering a wide range of eve ning courses  including basic, intermediate, advanced and master workshops, be ginning this week. There will be 11 separate lecturelabora tory courses for beginners in blackandwhite techniques, as well as a course on Four Views from Life, by four former Life photographers and a course on Psychologi cal Portraiture, by Philippe Halsman. Other courses are devoted to sound filmstrips, color printing, editorial pho tography, picture editing and photographic history. Regis tration is taking place now, and the phone number is OR 52700.

title: The Region's Jobless
description: TRENTONWhile Labor Depart ment officials in both Connecticut and New York were pointing to reduced unemployment rates, the New Jersey Legislature was called back in session last week to enact a special jobless benefits bill designed to ease the sting of the highest unemployment rate of any industrialized state in the nation.

title: U.S.Canadian Aviation Pact: More Routes
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 12.  The commercial aviation treaty agreed upon this week by the United States and Canada lays out the framework for a sweeping expansion of air traffic between the two coun tries.

title: Irwin's 200 Gains Lead Of 7 Shots
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S. C., Sept. 15 (AP) Hale Irwin, playing the course he loves best, hammered out a sixunderpar 65 today and moved into a sevenstroke lead in the third round of the $150,000 Heritage Golf Classic.

description: An investigation into ways of dealing with reserpine based drugs used to tranquil ize or combat hypertension in show horses will be made at a symposium in Washing ton on Friday.

title: Motel Desk Clerk Is Killed In $281 Holdup in Jersey
description: MAPLE SHADE, N.J., Sept. 15 (AP)A gunman killed a desk clerk early today in a $281 holdup at the Howard Johnson's Motor Lodge at Routes 38 amd 73 in this Bur lington County community, the police said.

title: The Drug Law
description: In the weeks preceding Sept. 1, When New York's new drug law took effect, the state spent nearly $500,000 to put across a simple message: Don't Get Caught Holding the Bag.

title: Stamps
description: THREE new commemo ratives are being put out by the United Na tions to press anew its determination to shape the future of a little known region at the tip of the con tinent of Africa.

description: WESTHAMPTON, L.L. The Town of Southampton's threeyearlong battle to buy 172 snits of surplus Air Fosse heinerg here for a ?? and middleincome ?? tive development is emit erred by residents of the Westhampton Reath school district who have moved to hit the acquisition.

title: Children's Train Derails
description: A train in an amusement park in the Sheepshead Bay section of Brooklyn derailed yesterday afternoon, slightly injuring the 18yearold driver and fwo children. The acci dent took place at the Peter Pan Playland.

title: ChiefJudge Race Really Is One
description: Who says judgeship races have to be dull?

title: REFORMS ADVISED IN POLICE LINEUPS
description: The Queens County grand jury that exonerated an assist ant district attorney of sexual abuse charges has urged re forms of police lineups to pre vent a repetition of serious flaws that marked the one from which two women picked the prosecutor last February as the man who had accosted them.

title: Photography
description: THERE are two Berenice Abbotts: the one who saved Atget's life work for posterity, and the one who takes pictures her self. There is always a dan ger of overrating the second Berenice Abbott out of grati tude to the first, and I al ways wonder, when I go to see her work, how it will stand up to her claim on our gratitude.

description: PRINCETONNow in second year of operation, professional theater company at Princeton University's Carter Theater plans an panded, but more carefully chosen, program of classic and modern plays.

title: Flood Forecasting Project
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Sept. 15 (AP)The Susquehanna River Basin Commission approved this week a $268,000 project to improve the floodforecasting system along the Susquehanna River and its tributaries. The agency must apply to Congress for funding of the project.

title: Numismaties
description: IT'S Philadelphia's turn to play host to the annual fourday convention of the Great Eastern Numis matic Association. The show opens to the public this Thursday in the Sheraton Philadelphia Hotel, 1725 John F. Kennedy Boulevard. The hours on Thursday, Friday and Saturd y will be 10 A.M. to 10 P. on the closing day, next Sunday, the hours will be 11:30 A.M. to 5:30 P.M. There is no admission charge.

title: Tax Change Is Broached

description: The Municipal Reference and Research Center will be moved from its present location in the Municipal Building to the Hall of Records following renova tions there.

title: Jolyn Vargxsh Married
description: RIVER EDGE, N.J., Sept. 15  Miss Jolyn Vargish, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Jacob J. Vargish, was mar ried in her parents' home here this afternoon to Joel A. Glass, son of Mrs. Emmanuel Glass of New York and the late Mr. Glass. Mayor John F. Curran performed the cer emony. The bride is assistant managing editor of Travel Age East in. New York and her husband is. Miami (Fla.) bureau chief of Travel Veek ly.

title: Parent and Child: Sexual liberation?
description: A freshman came to see me at the university infirmary complaining of swollen glands, fever and a rash. It was infectious mononucleosis, a diag nosis that considerably relieved the young man. It turned out that he had thought he had VD. I asked if there were a real possibility. His answer was startling  because of the igno rance revealed.

title: American Wants Ticket British Police Oblige
description: LONDON, Sept. 15 (Reuters) An American tourist re cently decided he would like a parking ticket as a souvenir of his motoring trip in Britain.

title: Watergate Panel Limiting Inquiry as Pressures Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15 The Senate Watergate commit tee, understaffed, pressed for time and faced with growing political pressures, intends to examine only samples of abuses in its forthcoming hearings on irregularities in the financing of political campaigns, accord ing to committee officials.

title: Rat Poison Ban Weighed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15 (UPI)  The Environmental Protection Agency said today that it would open an investi gation into whether certain rat poisons now approved for use should be banned or restricted.

title: New PATH Link Is Assayed
description: NEWARKWhat are New Jersey commuteis going to get out of the projected 20 mile extension of PATH serv ice from Newark to Newark Airport and on to Plainfield, all at a cost of $240million?

title: Architecture
description: IT'S standing room only in this preRevolutionary town, but then, it always has been. Old Town's narrow streets were built up early, a clapboardtoclap board sequence of Colonial, Federal and Greek Revival houses of stern simplicity in the best New England tradi tion, to which little could be added or subtracted. Things have remained crowded, aus tere and beautiful for several hundred years.

title: DAVID LEBRETON,89, A RETIRED ADMIRAL,
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15 (AP)  David McDougal LeEireton, a retired Navy rear admiral, died in Paris on Sept. 6. He was 89 years old.

title: Kennedy Makes A Move
description: That genial guru of the right, Barry Goldwater, waxed acerbic the other day in a New York Times article on the political outlook. Not just Richard Nixon, he said, but Edward Kennedy had been badly damaged by Water gate, which renewed discussion of the Senator's illfated accident on Chap paquiddick Island. Thus the Democrats who want to make the most of their opportunities to capitalize on a Mr. Clean image will find Teddy Kennedy a hard product to sell.

title: Golden Don First at 111 In Stakes
description: LIVONIA, Mich., Sept. 15 AP)Golden Don, an 111 shot, rallied on the final turn and shot past favored Tri Jet today to win the $100,000 silver anniversary running of the Michigan Mile and One Eighth.

title: Prospects Rise for Agreement Between Music Hall and Unions
description: Prospects for a peaceful set tlement of contract disputes be tween the Radio City Music Hall and its unions brightened yesterday.

title: House Painters, Sales Clerks and Construction Workers
description: Unlike the Roths' home, most of the cottages on Money Island have been winterized in the last five years, which allows owners to vacation here week ends the year round. But only a mi nority of people Iive here the entire year and have no other home. With his children now grown, Tom Jobson has sunk all his money and effort into fixing up his Money Island house and putting in the swimming pool, and has committed himself to a life of com muting to Asoury Park every day. Mon ey Island is also the only home of Linda and Charles Bradley, who have rented their house for five years now.

title: The long road from Malvern, Pa., to Esalen and Harvard
description: A young theologian remarked to me recently that a striking develop ment of our tithes was that theology isnow being written within an auto biographical framework. I replied, irreverently perhaps, that Augustine and John Henry Newman would be delighted.

title: Priscilla Heath, Garland Alumna, Bride of Sandy Hamill, Yale 73
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., Sept. 15Miss Priscilla Lang ford Heath was married here this afternoon to Chalmers Martin Hamill 3d, a student at the University of Connecti cut Medical College. In Farm inggtton, The Rev. Francis S. O'Neill performed the cere mony and celebrated the nup tial mass at the Roman Cath olic Church of St. Timothy.

description: On the Limits of Presidential Power

title: Police Can't Pin Down L.I. Boat Vandals
description: The Marine Bureau of the Nassau County Police had an idea this year it thought would help combat the nu merous boat thefts and in cidents of vandalism that occur year round in the county. Last January a county map went up on the office wall and since then the officers have dilligently mark ed with a pin the location of each boat theft or van dalism incident reported. They hoped the map would reveal a pattern that would enable them to formulate an appropriate patrol system.

title: Barclays' Taste for Adventure
Spiced with fresh air
description: September. October. Chilly mornings. Autumn sunshine. Time for a last weekend gettogether outdoors before the boat is lifted out of the water, the country house closed, the winter winds whistle. The brunch menu here is hearty enough to over come any hint of autumn chill. Make the casserole and biscuits at home and reheat in the galley or on a camp stove or hibachi on the beach, beside the lake or wherever.

title: SOVIET LETS 2 JEWS STUDY TO BE RABBIS
description: The Soviet Government has granted permission to two young Jewish students to study for the rabbinate at the Buda pest Rabbinic Seminary, the only functioning Jewish semi nary in Eastern Europe, it was disclosed here last Friday.

title: U. S. Lawyers for Micronesians Stir Up Officials
description: CHALAN KANOA, Saipan, Sept. 11In the remote Yap Islands, a man wants to re cover the son he fathered by an American Peace Corps woman who has taken the child home to Oregon.

title: 1973 Wrongs Desert Song
description: I AM a great believer in historical sympathy, by which I mean a willingness to try to see in the cher ished chestnuts of a time earlier than our own what the audiences of that earlier time thought they saw in them. Historical sympathy need only be, extended to chestnuts: masterpieces, after all, take care of them selves, renewing themselves effortlessly as the eons slip by. But when you can get a whiff of what it was like to really believe in a 19thcentury, melodramaThe TicketofLeave Man or The Octoroon, sayyou've half done the trick, half snuggled yourself into the skin, ears and eyes of a generation that casually, credited and even loved an atmosphere, a set of attitudes, now Long dead and gone. It's a matter of seeitig and feeling the world, for a moment, the way your notunintelligent grandmother saw it, and it's fun. Informative, too.

title: Sandra Etherington Bride of Horseman
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N.J., Sept. 15Miss Sandra Ben nett Etherington, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Roger B. Ether ington, was married here this afternoon to N. Lawrence Aspden 3d, son of Mrs. John F. O'Connor of Worcester, Pa. and Mr. Aspden Jr. of Bucks County, Pa.

title: Bill Russell Divorced
description: BOSTON, Sept. 15 (UPI) The wife of Bill Russell, former Boston Celtics basket ball superstar and now coach of the Seattle Supersonics, was granted a divorce yester day in Middlesex Superior Court. Mrs. Rose K. Russell, 37 years old, of Reading, will receive $900 a month sup port for herself and their three children. Russell, 39, last lived with his wife in April, 1969. Mrs. Russell charged him with cruel and abusive treatment.

title: Roach Joins Racing Unit As Information Director
description: James Roach, retiring sports editor of The New York Times, has been named pub lic information director for the New York State Racing and Wagering Board.

title: This Week in Sports
description: The annual Trenton Times 200 for Indianapolistype cars will be run Saturday and Sunday at Trenton In ternational Speedway. Gordon John cock, winner of the 1973 Indianapolis 500, is entered, along with A. J. Foyt, this year's Pocono 500 winner; Wally Dallenbach, winner of the California 500; Mario Andretti, Bobby and Al Unser and Joe Leonard. The USAC point leader, Roger McCluskey, will drive his McLarenOffy. Qualifying races for 20 positions begin at 11 A.M. Saturday. The 200mile race will start Sunday after a 30mile qualifying test at 1 P.M. for the final six positions.

title: Max Reger's Time Has CorneA imost
description: MAX REGER'S time may well yet come, but not apparently in America as of 1973, the centenary of his birth. Reger is generally, if begrudgingly, accorded a nlace with Mahler and Strauss as one of the major late German Romantics, but on those rare occasions when his mus..c is brought out into the open he consistently gets bad press: dietetic Franck, tuneless Brahms, glutinous and enervating are some of the milder judgments. This year's other musical cente narians  Rachmaninoff, Ca ruso, Chaliapin, even Daine Clara Butt  have received their due tributes via record ings and commemorative arti cles, but for Reger ... noth ing.

title: Audubon Outings Set for Cape May
description: CAPE MAYThe New Jer sey Audubon Society has in vited its members and friends to participate in a series of field trips next weekend. Pur pose of the trips is to observe the flora and fauna of Cape May, where the state's south ern tip is thrust into the At lantic Ocean and Delaware Bay.

title: Recordings
description: JUST SO STORIES. VOL. 1, by Rudyard Kipling. Read ers: Michael Hordern, Bar bara Jefford, Richard John son. Argo (Decca Record Company) ZSW 5123

title: Kirby Kulenski (16) of M
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Sept. 15 (AP)Wade Whatley, the quarterback, sneaked over in the fourth quarter today to give Auburn an 189 victory over Oregon State in a heat ed intersectional opener for both schools.

title: Above and Below Whose Seas?
description: Fifteen years ago (Sept. 15, 1958) the United States signed four conven tions approved by a Geneva conference on maritime law, but the curious fact is that there is still probably less world agreement on the rights of na tions in or under the high seas than ever before. The one more confusing legal area is definition of national air limitations.

title: PARLEY DISCUSSES PLIGHT OF WOMEN
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Sept. 15Speakers at a conference on aging have concluded that older women in the United States who are living alone face special emotional prob lems and economic and social discrimination.

title: Surprise! Landlord Approves Rent Strike
description: It may turn out to be one Of the shortest rent strikes in the history of Brooklyn.

title: Miss Montoya, Luke Haran Jr. Wed in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15  Miss Lynda Jean Montoya, daughter of Senator Joseph M. Montoya of New Mexico and. Mrs. Montoya of Wash ington and Santa Fe, was married here today to Luke John Haran Jr. of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Haran of South Dartmouth, Mass.

title: Opinion Awaited On Nuclear Plan
description: WASHINGTONAn Atomic Energy Commission advisory body has completed prelimi nary hearings on a proposal to construct a floating nu clear generator off the New Jersey coast, but its recom mendations, if any, will not be made for several weeks.

title: Israeli and American Jews. Ground for Conflict
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I.To be a Jew in America is to be in some measure different, alien, a minority. To be Jew in the state of Israel is to be part of the majority. This difference causes conflicting perceptions of so ciety, culture and self. To the Amer. ican Jew, society is shaped by oth ers, culture is to be approached from the fringes, and selfhood is defined at great psychic cost. The experience of marginality and alienationwhich American Jewish, writers raise to the dignity of a normis not only irrele vant but also contemptible to Israelis.

title: Mary Hambidge, Weaver, Dies; Led Mountain Crafts Foundation
description: CLAYTON, Ga., Sept. 15 Mary Crovatt Hambidge, who had an international reputation as a weaver, died on Aug. 29.

title: Ormandy, Unexpectedly, Leads Peking Orchestra
description: PEKING, Sept. 15Eugene Ormandy unexpectedly found himself conducting the Central Philharmonic Orchestra of Pe king this afternoon. It was only one movement of a Beethoven symphony during a demonstra tion, but it made him the first American conductor since the revolution to appear with a Chinese orchestra.

title: World News Briefs
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 15 South Korea's Justice Minis ter, Shin Jik Soo, promised a group of opposition legislators today that the Seoul Govern ment would arrest without fail the abductors who snatched a Korean opposition leader from a Tokyo hotel and spirited him to Seoul last month.

title: Company Will Trade In Its Cars for Compacts
description: HARTFORD, Sept. 15 (UPI) Aetna Life and Casualty announced yesterday that it would soon begin converting its corporate fleet to com pact cars.

title: S. N. Behrman, 18931973
description: THERE can be no ques tion that S. N. Behr man, who died last Sunday at the age of 80, was America's foremost playwright of comedies of manners. But Behrman went beyond the genre of drawing room comedy into the realm of the comedy of ideas. Like Moliere, he felt that correc tion of social absurdities must at all times be the matter of true comedy and under the glittering surface or his plays lay a sophisticated wisdom and a concern with contempo rary society. Behrman felt deeply but treated the ills of the world lightly; his weapon was the polished rapier, not the blunt meataxe.

title: LEATHER: THE REAL AND UNREAL
description: The skyhigh popularity of leathers is often matched by stratospheric prices. The result: this fall the fake takeoffs will be taking off, too.

title: Football And Politics
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15It's an un democratic thought, but whenever the President, the Senate and the House of Representatives agree on something in a hurry and almost unanimously, with shouts of approval from the peo ple, you can probably be sure that something's wrong and the thing won't last.

title: Family Affairs: Love Among the Generations
description: Had M. E. Kerr restrained her literary and academic impulses, If I Love You, Am I Trapped Forever? would have been a firstrate young adult novel. Her book is like a Mbi us strip onto which are stapled bits of World Lit, PopPsych, letters, clas sified ads, writing style tips and news items. It poses the eternal rhe torical question: What Is Love? yet supplies only the basis for a one dimensional reply.

title: MAURICE WILLIAM, AUTHOR, 92, DEAD
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 15  Dr. Maurice William, the Brook lyn dentist whose writings were credited with causing Dr. Sun Yatsen in 1924 to reject Marxist doctrine, died today in a convalescent hospital. He was 92 years old.

title: Military in Laos, Citing Hanoi's Role, Cool to Peace Pact
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Sept. 15 Reuters)  Senior army offi cers reacted coolly today to the new Laotian peace agree ment, and said real peace q,ould not he established un less North Vietnamese troops withdrew from Laos.

title: Trends
description: According to Talmudic tradition over the centuries, only mien may make up a minyanthe quorum of 10 adult Jews required for public worship. Last week, Conservative Judaism evoked outcries from Ortho dox Jewish leaders and moderate applause from feminists by announcing it would count women in a minyan.

title: School Eleven's Debut Spoiled by 1300 Loss
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Sept. 15 (AP)  Victory Chris tian, fielding 18 players for its first football game ever last night, left room for im provement.
